If you have any issues you want to raise or questions about me or my campaign then I would love to hear from you. Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope you will consider voting SDP at the next election.

I am a local business owner, a former Sussex Police Officer and hard-working Rother District Councillor. I know this constituency well. From working in my parent’s shop in Sidley High Street as a kid, to running a B&B on Bexhill seafront with my late husband, Tony. This is my home and I am ready for the chance to show folks in Westminster what being from Bexhill and Battle is all about.

After 14 years of Conservative failures in government, many voters are considering voting Labour, some for the first time in a long time. 

Under Sir Keir Starmer’s leadership, the changed Labour Party is ready to govern and improve things for ordinary people. I am really proud to be standing for Labour at this election with a realistic and achieveable set of priorities that will make a difference to our communities across the Bexhill and Battle constituency. 

Labour can win here, all I need is your support. I promise I will not let you down.

My three priorities for Bexhill and Battle:

Better public services – from public transport and the NHS, to school and nursery provision. I will continue my proven track record of protecting, supporting and improving local public services.

Cleaner, cheaper energy – Renewable, community-led energy generation to bring down prices. I will advocate for our rural, coastal constituency to benefit from Labour’s new GB Energy company.

More jobs for local people – Quality, well-paid jobs to improve the local economy. I will encourage new industry to bring in new jobs, particularly for young people.

VOTE LABOUR Vote for Christine Bayliss on Thursday 4th July

I will stand in opposition to the planned Asylum seeker centre in Northeye.  I am pleased to have been nominated by Northeye residents.

If we are not able to stop it we must make sure it is well managed and shortlived.

I will also be working alongside Connor Winter on Town Council.  Vote for both of us.

I’m standing to be Sussex’s police and crime commissioner because I want to see the county I love get the policing it deserves. We know what that looks like because so many officers deliver outstanding policing day-in day-out. I want everyone who lives in Sussex to be able to expect that level of professionalism regardless of the colour of their skin, background, gender or orientation. 

  I’ll focus on preventing crime and violence, women’s and girls’ safety and I’ll support better funding for youth services while working to ensure we have excellent officers who are welcomed to the heart of every community and every home.

When officers are closely connected to the communities they serve we get a healthier policing culture, but when they’re cut off, as appears to have happened with elements of the Met in London, the opposite happens. We need to break down barriers and replace any sense of ‘them and us’ with a bigger us that brings police and residents together.

 I grew up and live in Ticehurst. I went to local state schools and read philosophy and theology at Oxford. As a journalist and former foreign correspondent I campaigned on issues including human rights, miscarriages of justice, the treatment of migrant workers and sex trafficking.

 This statement has been prepared by Jonathan’s election agent; Keith Obbard, of The Green Party Office, 39-41 Surrey Street, Brighton, Sussex, BN1 3PB

As an Independent MP I will not be tied to any party and therefore able to fully represent YOU An MP who represents a party often has a conflict of interests; being a good Party Person and representing those in their constituency coupled with dividing their time between Party and Local Matters. As an Independent MP I will be able to devote the whole of my time working on behalf of my constituents. Living and working for the past 40 years in the Bexhill and Battle area has given me a huge insight into the local challenges facing everyone. My work will be to listen to those facing issues in their life and help find a way forward, so they never feel isolated. You can rely on me to truly represent your interests. Voting for me shows a great deal of trust in me as an individual, not a political party, but as a person who will be someone to turn to in a crisis and who will fight your corner with you. To find out more, what I stand for and to contact me, please visit www.jeffnewnham.org

I have lived in Bexley all my life and in my twentieth year as a councillor in the London Borough of Bexley. My working career started in M&S’ Bexleyheath store and I spent eleven years working for the company working from Saturday staff to a store management position. I now run my own consultancy business and lives locally with my wife, a teacher, and our ten-year old twins.    I was Labour’s candidate in the 2021 Old Bexley & Sidcup by-election, achieving a 10% swing to the party. As the parent of a child with cerebral palsy, I work closely with local parent groups supporting and campaigning on behalf of children with disabilities and their families both across the borough and nationally with SCOPE and the Changing Places campaign.   During my time on the Council, I have served as Cabinet Member for Transport under the last Labour administration from 2003-06 where I worked with trade unions to save direct Bexleyheath to Victoria train services, deliver road safety improvements, and ensure the Elizabeth Line came south of the river to Abbey Wood. I have also served as Leader of the Labour Group on the council, as a local school governor and charity trustee.

The Social Democratic Party is for those who are curious to understand the alternatives beyond the mainstream parties. Ideologically, the SDP combines social conservatism with centre-left economic policy, it is an open-minded party, run by ordinary people and proposes pragmatic policies. At the local level I care about reinvigorating communities, holding councils accountable and protecting our green spaces from ill-conceived developments. 

You won't find me on Social Media - real life is much more interesting! I'd gladly have a conversation if you want to email me.

Ian has lived in Yarnton with his wife Fiona for nearly 30 years. He's worked most of his life in retail and is now an ethical entrepreneur, business writer and retail analyst. He was elected to Cherwell District Council in 2019 as their first ever green councillor and to Oxfordshire County Council in  2021.  he also sits on three parish councils: Kidlington, Gosford and Water Eaton, and Yarnton.

Ian has campaigned on local flooding protection, road conditions, cycling infrastructure and local health service provision. He has been a fierce campaigner against the district council's plans to build on green belt in and around Kidlington, Begbroke and Yarnton, and since being elected has held the council and landowners to account on these plans numerous times. He also campaigns on affordable housing provision and animal protection issues.

I have lived in Oxfordshire for most of my adult life. I now live with my family in the Otmoor division, where I am heavily involved in the local community including as chairman of the governors at our local primary school. I am also a volunteer junior rugby coach. During the pandemic, I helped set up and administered a fund to support those negatively affected by COVID. My professional experience is in public policy making. For 13 years, I was a civil servant, working for the Treasury, Foreign Office, Department for International Development and Cabinet Office in London. Since 2012, I have held a senior leadership role at Oxford University, where I have helped to establish the Blavatnik School of Government. I am a keen cyclist, runner and walker, and am passionate about responding to the climate emergency and protecting our environment. Working in education and volunteering with young people, I want to ensure that every young person has the best start in life. As a community activist, I firmly believe that decisions are often best made at local levels and that, by listening respectfully and committing to find solutions, we can make things better together.

For twenty years, I've been campaigning for a more healthy environment, a kinder society where people treat each other with respect and public services that won't let us down.



It's a huge honour to be working to secure that better future here - with the backing of the whole Labour party - in the new Bicester and Woodstock constituency which includes Kidlington and Eynsham and so many other beautiful villages that I've known and loved all my life.



As a professional campaigner and leader for charities like Save the Children, and as former elected Councillor, I know how to stand up for people and work together with them to make change. I know how to influence policy and have won changes to the law. I can hit the ground running in Parliament.



As a mum of young kids, a carer for my late mother, and the partner of someone who runs a small business in the constituency, I know what it feels like to be juggling many challenges at once.

​

Everyone's challenges are different but we all deserve a stable economy run by grown-ups; quality, reliable public services and political representation by someone who listens and is ambitious on our behalf. That's the MP I want to be for you.

favourite_biscuit: Always have choices so a family selection box
statement_to_voters: I’m Catherine Evans and I am not interested in politics, I am interested in you and what I can do to make our lives in Birkenhead and Tranmere better for all. If you are feeling politically homeless, let down, forgotten about or lied to, by the main parties, you probably are. The mainstream parties care more for their own advancement and very little about the non-voters whose vote they do not feel they need. I am encouraging you to vote for me because your opinion and the quality of your life matters to me. I want to represent you. People come first  and their freedoms, rights and choices, not a party brand. If you feel your freedoms, your way of life, your hopes and aspirations are under threat, the Freedom Alliance puts people first. We believe you are more important that big corporations and globalist agendas. The people should be at the heart of policy making, we will insist your voices are heard. You should not be struggling to feed your children, or heat your homes, whilst international companies make millions from your hardships. Your lives should not be made harder by the unnecessary imposition of travel restrictions and reduction schemes. I will protect and promote your freedom of speech and assembly, bodily autonomy, movement and choice  on a local and a national level. I understand the frustration and desperation people are feeling and have chosen to step forward to restore that faith and trust in the democratic system. I want to bring decision making back to a local level. I cannot wait for someone else to save us, but I need you to help yourselves too, by taking a chance on me. Take back control, vote Freedom Alliance.

Stuart Kelly is the Liberal Democrat prospective MP for Birkenhead.

Stuart has been a Councillor for Oxton since 1997.

He works as an assessor for electrical apprentices.

Previously he has worked as an electrician in the local NHS and at Cammell Lairds.

Local health services have been brought to their knees, people’s mortgages and rent have skyrocketed and water companies have been allowed to pump their filthy sewage into our rivers and beaches. All this by a Conservative government more interested in fighting between themselves than standing up for the country.

This is your chance to vote for change. 

The long national nightmare comprising 4 failed Tory Prime Ministers and 9 years of chaos is coming to a close, this government has to go.

The more votes the Liberal Democrats achieve the more we can influence the future direction of the next Government.

My key priorities for Birkenhead are to -

Stop Sewage Dumping Water companies have pumped sewage into our rivers and seas more than 1 million times over the past three years – time to stop

Standing up for carers Carers – paid and unpaid, young and old – do a remarkable and important job. They deserve our support but are far too often forgotten and ignored. The recent PIP clawback demands should be written off

Ending Mental Health Injustice Mental ill health affects one in four of us. Liberal Democrats are fighting for a fair deal where mental and physical health are treated equally. We will prioritise early intervention to prevent people from experiencing a mental health crisis ; This means ensuring all young people can access support quickly.

Reform of the Regulators Ofwat have failed on protecting our rivers from sewage, Ofsted’s single word judgements are unsustainable, Ofgen’s failure to control energy bills has hit household budgets hard. All these regulators have failed and desperately need reform to protect consumers not protect shareholders.

Joining the single European market Restoring our links to trade with the Single European Market is essential to ensuring a prosperous trading economy, removing the unnecessary barriers to free trade will bring prices down.
Preet Kaur Gill MP for Birmingham, Edgbaston is Shadow Minister for Primary Care and Public Health, and the UK's first female Sikh MP.

Nicola is a teacher living in Moseley and working in West Bromwich, and strives every day to raise student success in the face of uneven school funding and economic pressures. If selected as the MP for Edgbaston, she will advocate for fairness across the educational system so that every child in Edgbaston – no matter their postcode or their family’s circumstances – has access to high-quality education.

Fairness will be the foundation of every decision Nicola takes. For example, on an international level, she will challenge the UK government’s delayed stance towards the genocide and repression in Gaza, and I will call for more consistent protection of human rights across the globe, from ending other genocides – in Xinjiang and Sudan, to name but two – to defending communities against the interests of fossil fuel companies.

On a national level, Nicola will champion the NHS and work to protect it against underfunding and creeping privatisation. The Queen Elizabeth hospital is a source of pride for the people of Edgbaston and a personal source of comfort to her, as the hospital that treated her father for leukaemia. She will work to maintain its status of excellence and to promote policies that prevent the need for people to go to hospital in the first place, such as the policy of improving air quality through funding a more affordable and more reliable public transport network.

Nicola looks forward to working with the people of Edgbaston and hopes you will join me on this journey towards real hope and real change.

I was proud to be elected as the Member of Parliament for Birmingham Erdington in March 2022, when I became Birmingham's first ever black MP.

Erdington has been my home for over 35 years. It's where my children were born, raised, and attended local schools.

I'm a qualified nurse and worked at the local health centre at Warren Farm Road in Kingstanding for several years. I also served as a district nurse in Birmingham for 25 years.

At the next general election, we have a once-in-a-generation chance to secure real change for our community and our country. We must rebuild our NHS, public services and put more police officers onto our streets. We can only do this with a Labour Government.

I was born, raised and still live in North Birmingham. I studied Business and Finance at Birmingham City University and currently work as a Data Analyst.

I have 14 years’ experience as a councillor in Perry Barr, Birmingham from 2004 to 2018. As well as being a ward councillor I also served as scrutiny chair for Transportation and Street Services (2009-2010) and the Children and Young People committee (2011-2012).

I am passionate about education and ensuring that every student has access to a good education. Every school should be a good school. I have been a school governor at both primary and secondary level.

I am also passionate about environmental and community issues. I am proud to call Birmingham my home, but I have seen the decline in the area over successive governments. We need to see real change in our community and investment into services. I am appalled by the cuts to youth services.

I am standing for the Green Party as they have the right policies to tackle the major issues in our society such as climate change, homelessness and the cost of living crisis.

Zain lives in Hall Green, where he grew up, and has witnessed the issues his community faces: underfunded schools, poor healthcare services and more. Zain says:

“I am running in this election because I feel it is time for new, young voices to decide our future. At 23 years old, I represent a generation that is enthusiastic, intelligent, and eager to confront our country’s most critical concerns. I am dedicated to addressing the issues that face our country today, including climate change, providing accessible education, and developing job opportunities that reflect the changing labour market.

I want to be a voice for individuals who feel unheard, and bring new ideas to the table. My campaign emphasises inclusivity, openness, and sustainability.

I believe in accountability and community involvement. By running for election, I hope to be a strong champion for our constituency, making sure that every voice is heard and respected. We can work together to make the future brighter for everyone.”

I have spent my entire working life at the grass roots in the public sector in children’s services, 30 years a Police Officer, 5 years with a homeless charity and the last two years I have been privileged to represent Moseley as a local Councillor.

My experience of working with communities of all faiths and none is that we all want the same core things for our families and friends: sound healthcare, good housing, clean air, affordable public transport, decent schools, good care provision for loved ones and a safe and welcoming neighbourhood.

Hall Green & Moseley has not had a committed local representative in Parliament for many years.  I believe it is time for change.  I would harness the knowledge and guidance of local experts, business and community power, to champion Hall Green and Moseley and our fabulous city. I’d work collaboratively to bring investment and improvement to tackle the inequalities and injustices we see every day. I would get things done and I would hold people to account.

I’ve been deeply saddened by the destructive and detrimental impact of the current Conservative Government. From a disastrous Brexit to a woeful lack of progress on environmental matters and trashing our economy, they have let us down now, and they have let down future generations too.

Birmingham Labour have brought us local austerity too. The cuts caused by their mismanagement will be deep and devastating, and they will impact people for generations.

Liberal Democrats want to do things differently.

We will fight to undo the disaster of Brexit, to return to stronger, better international relations that allow the big issues such as international conflicts and climate change to be resolved at the right level.

We will fight to fix services in Britain so that it doesn’t feel like everything is broken.

We want a fair deal for you, and I will fight for that in this election.

I am proud to stand for Birmingham Hall Green & Moseley as the Liberal Democrat parliamentary candidate.

post_label: Birmingham Hodge Hill and Solihull North
Birmingham Hodge Hill and Solihull North
Birmingham Hodge Hill and Solihull North
statement_to_voters:
Imran has lived in Hodge Hill for most of his life and attended Hodge Hill School. He has worked in education for over 12 years, represented parents as school governor, volunteered with the Youth Offending Service and also acted as a local football coach.

Having been a member of the Green Party for over six years, Imran stood as a local candidate previously. He is standing as a Parliamentary candidate now because he is passionate about social and environmental justice. He will campaign to highlight local issues which have been neglected, such as the poor standards of the local environment and the safety issues. Imran says:

“I will work to eliminate fly-tipping and keep our streets and parks clean, and make Birmingham’s roads safer by putting an end to speeding and knife-crime. Our libraries must stay open, and investment in our public services must continue. The cost-of-living crisis is affecting more and more of us. I want a fairer deal for us all.

“The ongoing crisis in the Middle East has highlighted the failure of our government to uphold international law and human rights. This must be addressed as it goes against our moral and ethical standards of upholding civil liberties and human rights for all.”

Zoe is standing to be a voice for Ladywood in Westminster: to advocate for decent homes, education, healthcare, and transport, to speak out about the challenges Ladywood faces, to protect its resources like the reservoir, the residents of the Ladywood Estate and more. Zoe is a leader who will take action to protect our planet and your lives, as well as your children’s futures.

Zoe believes that the Green Party’s policies on Universal Basic Income, public transport, free childcare, inclusivity and protecting the planet, are all key to building that better future. Zoe says:

“Growing up in Ladywood, I know first hand that despite being statistically one of the most deprived areas in the UK, Ladywood is in fact rich. Rich in diversity, talent, history, grassroots activity, sports, the arts, education, and much, much more! Ladywood deserves an advocate who will celebrate all it has to offer, while fighting for better, much better, provision for residents.

“The Green Party envisions a better, fairer society. I want to be part of creating that society for Ladywood – it is perfectly possible if enough of us act together. Will you join me?”

I am passionate about Birmingham and proud to campaign and fight elections in my home of Ladywood. Residents often tell me that they are tired of a complacent Labour taking their votes for granted – and I relish giving them more choice in elections.

I have long campaigned for Mental Health service provision to receive full equality with physical health – a journey started by the LibDems in government, and one we must continue. Social Care is in crisis and carers urgently need fair wages and better support. All of this means that we have a big mountain to climb, but I have been lucky to meet some inspirational people across Birmingham who are working to make this happen, and I continue to support them.

I’m a qualified Teacher and so very much aware of the pressures faced by teachers and staff, as well as students. I support young people in various ways, such as helping them grow their campaigning experience and supporting them standing for election.

I also believe it’s vital that our environmental protections are strengthened, and that civil liberties for LGBT+, BME and others are protected and improved.

We have so much to be proud of in Birmingham: a super diverse community that tells the story of Britain's history, thriving small businesses providing jobs and driving our regional economy, and a hope that things can be better for our city and its people.



We've been let down by 14 years of successive Conservative governments - crime and antisocial behaviour is rising, our public services have been decimated, and divisive and damaging rhetoric at the top level of government is the new normal.



It doesn't have to be that way. We can put an end to Conservative rule, and put the voice of Brummies at the heart of the next government. But to do that, I need your support. This is the most important election in a generation: make your vote count.

Born into a family legacy of milkmen, my journey began in the humble setting of a local primary school. Progressing through secondary education, I pursued higher learning with vigour, culminating in the attainment of an LLB honours degree, followed by a master's degree.

Embarking on my professional journey, I dedicated two years to apprenticing at a prestigious law firm, honing my skills as a qualified solicitor. Subsequently, I undertook a pivotal role at Maurice Andrews Solicitors in 2014, initially offering my services pro bono as the firm approached its closure.

Through staunch dedication and demonstrable value, I earned the recognition of Mr. Andrews himself, who began compensating me on a commission basis for the clientele I brought in. This pivotal moment marked the trajectory towards my eventual ascension to Director of Maurice Andrews Solicitors in 2016.

Beyond the confines of legal practice, I have made significant strides in digital outreach, leveraging platforms like TikTok and Instagram to share educational content and cultivate a substantial online following. since 2021, I have accumulated followers in surplus of 350,000 accross various social media platforms and gain millions of view accross videos.

Personally, my greatest joys stem from my family life. Blessed with four beautiful children and a steadfastly supportive wife, our household is anchored by love and encouragement. As our children pursue their education in comprehensive schools, I am reminded of the importance of fostering a nurturing environment for their growth.

Rooted in a rich cultural background and driven by a deep-seated desire for success, my journey epitomises an unwavering commitment to self-sufficiency and entrepreneurial spirit, a legacy inherited from my father and embraced with fervour from an early age.

Rob Grant is a Birmingham City Councillor representing Kings Norton South, which is within the Northfield constituency. As a councillor, he knows the many deprived areas in Northfield and the uneven level of investment since the closure of MG Rover in 2005, which has left many areas behind.

If elected to parliament Rob will apply his broad life and professional experience to stand up for local communities, organisations, and businesses.

Rob is passionate about issues that affect our quality of life: housing, transport,health, pollution. He will campaign for proper funding for the NHS and social care, and effective action on pollution and the environment. Rob says:

“I have lived in our diverse and energetic city for 32 years. I have worked in education for the past 20 years, currently as a college lecturer, and I have first-hand experience of the concerns of young people.

“If elected I will work tirelessly to achieve a vision of an improved social, economic, and greener Northfield. I will represent the interests and aspirations of local communities and businesses. I will challenge existing approaches to tackling and resolving issues and concerns from central and local government, and champion a drive towards decentralisation and for local decision making.”

Kefentse Dennis is standing for Perry Barr with a commitment to advocating for social justice. He believes that the voices of people in places like Aston, Lozells and Handsworth should be heard, and they should be given the opportunity to vote for investment in people and the planet, including where they live.

As your candidate, Kefentse will highlight such pressing issues as housing, air quality, and green spaces. If elected, Kefentse will utilise his qualifications in environmentalism in order to work towards a greener future, focusing on the local economy, public transportation, and community engagement.

Kefentse has experience working with trade unions and has chaired the internal Green Party group “Greens of Colour”. He has campaigned for policies including: calling for an immediate end to violence in Gaza and Israel, support for Palestinian rights and recognition of a Palestinian state; as well as the introduction of a Universal Basic Income; a wealth tax to fund the social investment we desperately need; a retrofit revolution; building more social housing, with rent controls for private housing; and a commitment that all new builds must meet environmental standards.

Ayoub Khan is currently a Councillor for the Aston Ward which is part of the Perry Barr constituency. Ayoub declared that he would stand as an Independent following his reluctance to be silenced on the topic of Gaza by his former political party. Ayoub said that political leaders have a duty to represent the residents without fear. Politicians are slaves to the public and NOT political parties.

Ayoub is also a Barrister by profession and said that having a legal background will naturally allow him to advocate on behalf of all the residents.

Jane Baston is standing as the Green Party’s candidate for Birmingham Selly Oak. She moved to Birmingham two years ago and has lived in the Selly Oak constituency since moving. She has been an active member of the Green Party for the past 4 years. Jane has worked closely with the local Green Party councillors to stand up for local services and will continue to do so as your MP. 

Jane works for an educational charity and studied genetics and archaeology at University. She is an active UNISON member and is part of the Green Party Trade Union Group Committee, where she has campaigned locally and nationally to improve working conditions and to protect workers’ rights.

Jane has been the Co-Chair of the Green Party’s youth and student wing, the Young Greens, for the past three years supporting young people and students across England and Wales. She has a wide range of experience working with local groups and charities. She is passionate about campaigning for better funded youth services, safer streets, and fixing the housing crisis.

Hi, my name is Kamel. I'm a lecturer at a local university, a parent and a human rights campaigner. After 6 years of being a member of the Labour Party, I resigned because like so many others I felt betrayed by it.

As a Palestinian, I'm shocked and appalled that both Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer have justified war crimes against the people of Gaza. Steve McCabe, the ex-Labour MP for Selly Oak and the Chair of Labour Friends of Israel, has gone as far as justifying the bombing of children, women and hospitals in Gaza.

Under 14 years of Tory rule - a worsening housing crisis, a cost of living crisis and an energy crisis. Our NHS is underfunded and our schools are struggling too. Working people's wages do not cover rent, food and bills. T They had millions of pounds for ineffective PPE during the Covid-19 pandemic and to fund wars and genocide yet nothing for our welfare system. Instead of providing a real opposition, the Labour Party has abandoned so many of it's promises and cannot be trusted to support us.

I care deeply about the issues affecting the people of Selly Oak and that's why I've decided to stand as a Parliamentary Candidate for Selly Oak on the 4th July.



 Commitments:

Demand the immediate recognition of Palestine and support the ICC and ICJ accountability rulings.

Demand the building of social rent homes to fix the housing crisis and to

end homelessness.

Fight to save our NHS from privatisation and to pay staff what they deserve.

Support the scrapping of university tuition fees and bring back student grants.

Support calls for a 'wealth tax' to pay for our welfare system and public services.

Fight to save our planet, put energy back into public hands and invest in sustainable energies.

Campaign to end arms sales to regimes that violate human rights.

Campaign to stop local cuts to services and libraries in our community.

Roxanne is passionate about environmental and social justice. She believes in the power of communities to make change and has a background in managing local community projects. Roxanne has managed a number of major national projects focused on investing in community infrastructure, providing skills development and improving access to nature. She currently works in operations management, leading on systems development and people management for an international NGO working on global tax reform and wealth redistribution.

Roxanne has been involved in a number of environmental and feminist organisations throughout the 20 years she has lived in Birmingham. She has a degree in Philosophy and Politics and a masters in Global Ethics. Roxanne believes that the current system is failing us all and we all have the right to live a good life, where everyone has the resources and the support they need to flourish and achieve their potential. She is passionate about arts and culture and committed to investing in local services and infrastructure like libraries and parks.

Roger is the Deputy Leader of the Lib Dem Group on Birmingham City Council. He serves on the Housing and Neighbourhoods Scrutiny Committee and is one of the four Councillors, one from each party, on the Council who successfully proposed the Climate Emergency Motion. He now sits on the Taskforce that was set up as a result.

Roger’s priorities are:

1)            To secure greater investment in the NHS, especially to cut waiting times to see GPs, improve care for those with mental health problems

2)            To improve education and youth services, increasing investment in our schools and to provide better facilities for our young people.

3)            To tackle crime and anti-social behaviour by increasing the size of our Neighbourhood Police Teams and protecting their local bases.

Roger believes the UK’s best interests are served by remaining a member of the EU and argues that a no deal Brexit would be particularly damaging to Yardley.

The coming General Election will be a fight between Labour and the Lib Dems in Yardley. Both parties have won the seat twice in the last 4 General Elections. As a local resident with a strong history of representing the area on the Council Roger is well placed to continue the Lib Dems history of success in the seat.

My name is Jody McIntyre, and as a Birmingham resident, I was shocked and dismayed to discover that our local MP in Birmingham Yardley, Jess Phillips, is a member of Labour Friends of Israel. For the last six months, we have witnessed tens of thousands of innocent men, women, and children in Gaza being brutally murdered. Yet at the same time, our local representative, Jess Phillips, is a "friend of Israel". This is unconscionable. The people of Birmingham Yardley do not support genocide, mass murder, and the deliberate starvation of a civilian population. We support equality and justice for all people. The leader of Labour, Keir Starmer, said that Israel had the right to cut off water and electricity to Gaza, and we will never forget that.

 

The Labour party has made a grave misjudgement on this, and Jess Phillips has made a grave misjudgement by continuing her membership of Labour Friends of Israel, even in the face of a genocide. So for that reason, at the next general election, I, Jody McIntyre, will be running for MP in Birmingham Yardley. The Labour party are responsible for supporting a genocide, and the people of Birmingham Yardley do not.

 

Donate whatever you can to support my campaign. Together, we can make something historic happen.

favourite_biscuit: I like all the biscuits except Hobnobs which taste like sawdust.

statement_to_voters:
Bishop Auckland is my hometown, it's where we've put down roots and chosen to raise our family. I work in Research and Innovation at Durham University, my wife is a student midwife in the NHS, our kids go to local schools and colleges, and we're invested in the community.



I am standing to be our MP for the opportunity to serve and make a real difference for the people and place I love.



I admire people I meet every day who, despite being let down by a failing government, just get on with it: setting up businesses in a challenging economic climate, teaching in underfunded schools, treating patients in an understaffed NHS, and volunteering for neighbourhood clean-up teams, foodbanks, and youth clubs. But we are swimming against the current. After fourteen years of Tory government Britain is poorer, more unequal, and less influential in the world. We need a decade of national renewal to turn things around and MPs who serve the national interest, not their self-interest.



I've had a varied career in Business, Higher Education, and the Charity sectors. I studied Development Economics at Manchester University and have a strong interest in helping struggling economies to flourish -- including growing our local economy! I went on to specialise in conflict prevention and reconciliation, working in places affected by civil war, advising governments, charities, and the UN. So, my skills are in bringing people together to solve complex problems and build stronger communities.



I have also taught at school, college, and university levels, and I am passionate about helping our young people reach their potential, as I was helped in my teens by the policies of the last Labour government.



I don't come from money. My family struggled. I have been blessed with the opportunity of a great education but had to work 30-hour weeks on top of full-time study to pay my way through university. I have waited tables, stacked shelves, mopped floors, and laboured outside in all weathers. So, I know what it's like to support my family on low paid insecure work. Some of the people closest to me still do. I have fought my whole life, and I'll fight hard for everyone in our communities across Bishop Auckland, Crook, Shildon, and all the villages across Teesdale, and Weardale.

Kate Hollern was selected as the Prospective Parliamentary candidate for Blackburn at a meeting of all Party members on 30 March 2014. Kate was first elected as the Labour MP to represent Blackburn in May 2015 and was re-elected in June 2017 and December 2019. She has called Lancashire home for over 40 years and has a political career spanning 20 years.

Before entering parliament Kate was the Leader of the Labour Group on Blackburn & Darwen Borough Council and leader of the Council from 2004-2007 and 2010 until 2015. Kate has played an important political leadership role at both a regional & national level and is honoured to be able to represent Blackburn residents in parliament.

On re-selection for the next election, Kate said "It is an Honour to represent Blackburn in Parliament - I made the town my home over 40 years ago and I brought my daughters up here. I undertake regular surgeries across town and my team are available to help residents throughout the year".

Lorraine joined the Labour Party at 16 some 42 years ago, she believes strongly in the Socialist values of Labour and trade union movements.

Lorraine has helped to deliver FREE swimming for all the children of Fleetwood, and FREE travel on the Tram network for all NOW card users after this was taken away by the Conservative Austerity agenda.

Lorraine is a founding member of The Fleetwood Festive Lights Committee and has been helping light up Fleetwood for well over a decade.

Lorraine says: “Fighting for Fleetwood and the wonderful people who dwell in it has been a privilege, and I am grateful for the chance to support my community and get the voice of the people who live in our lovely town heard.”
About: see https://poe.com/s/X4WLkLkPV2bG8VtOH03G

Why vote for me?

I'm closely associated with our struggle here on the Fylde, to stop the shale gas industry bringing the risky process of fracking to our community but am standing for so much more than this. Our governments have bailed out banks and enforced austerity - never considering bailing out healthcare, bailing out education, bailing out Britain. We see services cut in rural areas, leaving residents isolated with poor transportation, no libraries, no post office, no community. Our lives are not being enriched by government, they are burdened.

Lobbyists for industry are heard and aided, even when their plans put people at risk; something is clearly very wrong. This attitude permeates all sectors from our underfunded NHS to over-priced education, It is only by getting more Green MPs into Westminster that we can hold the government to account and build on the great work of Caroline Lucas.

Chris Webb is Blackpool born and bred, a true Sangrown'un. Chris lives in Blackpool South with his wife.

As the son of a Blackpool postman and teaching assistant, Chris has spent most of his adult life working in the public sector, following in their footsteps, most recently as the Deputy Police and Crime Commissioner for Lancashire.

As a leading voice in Blackpool's charity sector and a front-line public sector worker, he has a real track record of fighting for Blackpool's communities and continuing to put Labour values into action across Blackpool and has been awarded a Local Community Hero award for his charity work during the pandemic.

Chris has been fighting to eliminate child poverty in Blackpool for over a decade. He has been raising awareness, fundraising, and giving his time to help deliver 12,000 meals to local families each week through the food bank.

He's led the charge for improved mental health support for residents with the Blackpool Mental Health charity he helps lead as Chair of Trustees, which was awarded Blackpool Charity of the Year in June 2023.

When 800 local police officers were cut, as Deputy PCC, he launched new Police Task Forces to tackle local priorities, including drug dealing, anti-social behaviour, and burglary.

And when the Conservative MP for Blackpool South voted against free school meals, Chris stepped up and raised over £14,000 to ensure no child went hungry in the town that half term.

I have lived on the border of Blaenau Gwent & Rhymney since 1989 and worked in Ebbw Vale for 6 years as a tutor for Access Students who wanted to make a new start. It’s time for a new start now and a move away from Labour. The people of Blaenau Gwent and Rhymney are talented and committed to their communities. My job will be to harness that for a new beginning.

Labour have taken local people for granted for too long in Wales and the Conservatives hardly know Wales exists. It’s time for a voice in Westminster that will speak up for people in Blaenau Gwent instead of focusing on London and the South East. Much of what you see day to day in Blaenau Gwent is delivered by the devolved Labour Government in Cardiff. There is little to address the level of child poverty, access to care and delivering on transport. The dangers of climate change cannot be over-emphasised but Labour have reneged on that commitment too. You will get more of the same with Labour.

party_name: Plaid Cymru - The Party of Wales

statement_to_voters:
Vicky Anderson is the Liberal Democrat candidate for Blaydon and Consett. She was elected as a local Liberal Democrat Councillor in Gateshead for Dunston Hill and Whickham East in May 2019, winning against Labour. 

Local to the North East, Vicky is passionate about the region where she grew up and the wealth of talent and ambition it has to offer. Vicky also believes strongly in creating a fair, open and accepting society for all, and is a passionate advocate and campaigner for equality, LGBTQ+ and women’s rights.

[Copied from https://durham.greenparty.org.uk/ge2024-candidates/#richardSimpson]

The next General Election will be the most important in a generation.

The foundations of our democracy and our way of life are under attack as never before.

Corruption is happening in plain sight.

Our rights and freedoms are being dismantled bit by bit.

The wealth we’ve created for this country over decades is being stolen from us.

Our living standards have flatlined for 14 years, poverty is rising. Where’s our money gone?

Only the Green Party is committed to returning Power to the People and resisting the forces which put Profit before People and the Planet.

Returning me, Richard Simpson, as your Member of Parliament will be your Act of Resistance. Your way of saying ‘Enough is Enough.’ A howl of protest against the selling off of our country without our consent.

I have lived in Blaydon and Consett for nearly 40 years. I know what strong communities we have and how much pressure we’ve been under, and will continue to be, if there isn’t a Vote for Change.

Make Your Vote Sensational.

Vote for Hope. Vote for Change. Vote Green

It's been a huge privilege to serve as the Member of Parliament for

Blaydon and to have delivered so much for my constituents, but I

know we have so much more we need to achieve, that is why I will be

campaigning to become the first Labour MP of Blaydon and Consett.

The Conservatives have pushed our communities to the brink with

successive years of funding cuts, they have neglected our region for too

long. I will work to bring real investment into our area and my focus is on

ensuring the communities of Blaydon and Consett can thrive.

I want to hear from you and about your views. Our politics is always

stronger when people engage with the process and I want to be your

voice in Parliament for the Blaydon and Consett constituency

Maureen was born in Morpeth on 21 May 1966 and has lived most of her life in Blyth.

Maureen spent her working life in a variety of roles and has worked in the private, public and voluntary sector.  She worked for a Solicitor, Building Society and Housebuilders before moving to a Credit Union and later working for North Tyneside Council.  She gave up her job in early 2020 to support in the office of the Blyth Valley MP and she also works part-time for 2 MPs.

The majority of her career has been spent in people facing roles and often supporting individuals and families through difficult or stressful situations such as moving home or for debt management.  During the time she worked for a Credit Union, Maureen supported those on low incomes to manage their finances and access savings and loan accounts.  She worked with individuals and families as well as delivering sessions to young parents, schools and training to community groups. 

Maureen married and raised a family in Blyth and understands the difficulties faced by working families around managing childcare and career.  She worked part time and served as a school governor and helped with reading in classes whilst her children were in First School.  She experienced the challenges of supporting a child with a learning disability through education and into employment and understands the issues and challenges faced by many parents throughout the education journey.

Maureen wants to see everyone reach their full potential and is a champion for social mobility.  She is passionate about supporting young people to achieve their goals and has supported efforts to improve youth work, education and training opportunities throughout the area.

Like many around her, Maureen became angry at the neglect of her home town over many decades and she vowed to do something to change this. She is delighted at the funding that has been obtained for the regeneration of Blyth and she continues to work closely with businesses owners to support them during the regeneration of the town.   

She is chair of Better Blyth and Treasurer for Blyth Constitutional Club.

As a Croft resident, married with 3 children, I find my kids keep me young. My kids' future, just like yours, is paramount . I aim to restore the community by tackling social issues such as isolation, mistrust and  disenchantment.

Carol Birch, was elected Arun District Councillor in May 2023 following being Aldwick Parish Councillor since 2019. Chair of Housing and Wellbeing. As a Parish Councillor she has made a difference through installation of solar panels on the parish office building, trees planted across the parish and has been a vice chair of the Aldwick Parish Planning committee. Carol works in social housing leading a team of specialists in benefits and tenancy support. In the Green Party she has been a key member of the team that has successfully elected 6 Arun district councillors who have in turn been able to make a valuable difference in Arun but there is much more to do. Carol, as an Arun District Councillor, is working towards a more sustainable local plan as it is reviewed.  There are five key areas of policy, amongst many, that make the Green Party better for Arun. Renationalise the water companies, the only way to ensure your money goes to treat sewage not to someone else's back pocket. Stop the privatisation of the NHS. Build houses in the right place at the right price, including social housing. Fund the Environment Agency to ensure flood prevention works for Arun. Introduce Proportional Representation to ensure everyone's vote counts. She will also approach each decision to evaluate for Climate and Environmental impact and whether it will reduce the impact of the Cost of Living for voters.

Independent Candidate, formerly Conservative. I'm standing for the District and The town  Council. I pledge to be communicative, and available. I will support regeneration in Bognor Regis that retains sufficient parking and open space. I will support the towns' growth in terms of its' attraction to tourists and visitors, offering events and activities, a better night time economy, and improving beach access. I will support initiatives to cull anti social behaviour in the town, and which tackle drug related problems and homelessness.

I live on the West Sussex coast, with my husband, Chris.

I’m a well-connected, experienced political campaigner and fundraiser, and a successful senior business leader, specialising in technology and cybersecurity.

I’ve worked across multiple industries, volunteered as a trustee of a national charity, Meningitis Now, and I have observed US Primary elections as a guest of the US State Department.

I have a political background, but I’ve achieved this whilst building a successful business career, a broad voluntary portfolio, and a happy family life, with Chris, and my three step-daughters.

In short, I have gained an unusual breadth of experience and expertise. With such a varied life experience, I relate to and connect easily with people from every walk of life. I would love to use it to make our country, and Bognor Regis and Littlehampton, an even better place to live.

I was born in Rustington and grew up in Barnham, and I am delighted to be standing for the Heritage Party in Bognor Regis and Littlehampton in the General Election on 4th July 2024.

The Heritage Party stands for common-sense principles that will restore purpose and prosperity to our nation:

- Protect our culture and heritage  - Free speech and liberty  - Traditional family values  - Stop gender ideology and sexualisation in schools  - National sovereignty  - Control our borders  - Financial responsibility  - Self-sufficiency in skills  - Self-sufficiency in energy  - Support our farmers  - No more lockdowns  - Disentangle from foreign wars  - Pro life

The nation desperately needs a change in politics from the old parties that have been running down our nation over many decades. The Heritage Party is the change we need: we are patriotic, traditional, and will make the most of our opportunities to thrive by restoring our nation.

I am honoured to have been selected to be Labour Parliamentary candidate for Bognor Regis and Littlehampton! Knowing the positive change a Labour government will bring to my community has been the inspiration behind the work I have been putting in both locally and nationally to make this happen.



I was born in Coventry, but moved to Canada as a child, coming back to complete GCSEs, then going on to university studying history, law and international development. I moved to the area when I became a Special Guardian to my two children, placed with me by social services. I knew they needed to be raised surrounded by a community that would encourage them to thrive. Being a Special Guardian and kinship carer has reinforced my belief in the need for change, for recognition of the realities of care work, who is carrying out this work and how it can be supported. Too many in our communities are left behind, doing the best they can to care for their families and those around them, but finding that ends don't meet all too often and the systems that are supposed to help are inaccessible.



My Mum is a nurse. I've watched her work hard in our NHS, committed to delivering the highest standard of care. Under the Conservatives this has become increasingly difficult, year after year having resources cut, no or extremely low pay rises and almost as importantly, the constant narrative of blame. I will be a strong advocate for the NHS, working for fair pay and conditions for staff and the highest level of care for all patients.



Bognor Regis and Littlehampton need good green jobs and investment that brings security to our communities. I want to understand and advocate for new technologies and consider new ways of managing our economy to ensure we prioritise wellbeing as a route to productivity.



My family and I used to live near the beach, something our children loved, but our beautiful beach was frequently unfit for bathing because of sewage pollution. We must hold the water companies to account, force investment and ensure there is enforcement of environmental standards.



Labour's commitment to halve violence against women and girls is inspiring. Underfunding of our justice system and the lack of understanding of the causes of this problem amongst Conservative policy makers are holding back progress in this crucial area. Gender based violence is an issue that negatively impacts everyone in our society and globally, I will work to meet this commitment.



In working to be elected in Bognor Regis and Littlehampton I will listen to constituent's concerns, understand your needs and work to bring about the positive change we need.

I have worked as Head Gardener in a North East Derbyshire garden for the last 22 years and am observing the effects of climate change on a daily basis. Not just the extremes like the current flooding and last year’s heatwave but changes in flowering times and weather patterns that are increasing in frequency and severity. 

We are living at the beginning of a climate emergency  and this election should only be about the solutions to climate change as these will bring about a more equitable and fair society.

But the disruptors and destroyers of society are intent on spreading division by making this an election about Brexit. I am very happy with the Greens position on holding a second referendum and will campaign fiercely to remain.

I have spent the last 3 years leading the local fight against the chemical giant Ineos who had intended to drill a fracking well in our village. This fight has recently been won  with the government moratorium on fracking which needs to be converted into a total ban by the next Green government. I have my own YouTube channel The Fracking Farmhouse which has been used as part of the campaign.

Vote Green because the climate is more important than Brexit.

I am a fifty-six-year-old businessman from Chesterfield, married with one grown up son. I was born and bred in Sheffield and have working class roots, which I am proud of. It gave me a firm appreciation of the few things we have and taught me the value of a good honest day’s work and getting stuck in, since we had little other choice. There is definitely no silver spoon element here. Everything we have in life is what my wife and I have worked hard for and continue to do so to this day. I have an interest in history and read quite widely.

My early working years, between 1987 and 2004, were in finance. I worked for the Prudential Assurance Co, The Midland Bank/HSBC, and then two large accountancy practices in Sheffield servicing business clients. So while I do not claim to be an expert in any of these areas, I believe that those years gave me a decent look behind the scenes at how money works. I have an insight into the world of insurance, savings and investments, banking, accountancy, taxation and how businesses run in general.

This is not bad groundwork for any aspiring politician, I guess, and one that gives me perhaps more experience than someone who has just popped out of university with a degree in rocket science. From 2004, I have been running my own vintage motorcycle business. It’s a hobby gone mad for me and has been lots of fun. I have met some quite remarkable characters and learnt an awful lot about our automotive history. More importantly I have learnt from hard experience what it takes to survive in business.

Being self-employed means you have no sick pay, no holiday pay, no pension plan or cushy benefits such as a company car, medical insurance or an annual Christmas bonus. If you make a mistake in business, you pay for it yourself. This translates to being able to work hard all month and some months finding yourself worse off financially than when you started.

Have I had months where I‘ve lost money? Absolutely, and when you’re paying personally for waste or mistakes, you learn quick. When your own cash is on the line it is a fine master. It is something many employees never experience, and I feel do not perhaps fully appreciate.

Business has also shown me the harsh reality of red tape, of accounts to be done, of VAT returns to be completed, of health and safety, of rates, bills and local government interference, etc. Frankly, small businesses are deluged with hassle. Making a profit is the least of it sometimes.

So what have I seen during these last four decades working? Well, the 1987 stock market crash was up close and personal for me. I witnessed the Millennium bug scam unfold followed by the tech stock bubble bursting. I lived through the 2008 banking crises which triggered the recession and the ‘austerity years’ (have they finished?).

We all lived through the surreal lockdowns of the pandemic and most recently the cost-of-living crisis, where everything seems to have doubled in price regardless of reason. It has all been a remarkable financial roller coaster. Working to survive can be hard enough, but when outside forces collude to make all our lives so much harder, I’ve found myself gnashing my teeth in frustration with everyone else. Which brings me nicely to politics

Just like you, I’m sick and tired of powerlessly watching car-crash politics in the UK along with ambulance-chasing politicians who leap on the latest disaster to score some minor political point. I am tired of the weekly Punch and Judy show in Westminster where seemingly ‘detached from reality’ members score political points off each other across the dispatch box, while the world outside merrily goes to the dogs.

I am tired of hearing about (and more pertinently paying for) London's problems or the seeing the country's sole reliance on the one great industry... the city/banking, etc. I am tired of seeing all the other industries being left to whither on the vine. Fishing has been parleyed off, farming is on its knees, mining has gone, steel has gone, shipbuilding has gone, the automotive industry has been sold off or is a shadow of its former self – industry of all types has been actively run down. Even the utilities and trains have been flogged off and run into the ground. We are now apparently just a ‘service economy’.

Politically, we have had people shouting at each other across the dispatch box in Westminster since Oliver Cromwell established the place in 1650. I have to ask in all seriousness, where has it actually got us? The industrial revolution did not start in Westminster, nor the age of empire, nor the age of remarkable technologies, and even in terms of law-making... how much further on are we than the Magna Carta? All of these started outside the M25 in that strange wider world known as Great Britain, which is where I would like to focus.

It is time in my life to start giving a little back and I believe I can add a little value, for what it is worth. Like you, I am sick of not being listened too. I fall down the same potholes as you, pay the same taxes as you and struggle, like you, to survive. I am listening to your problems because I share them. Let’s focus on local issues and build jobs and a brighter future here together. What I am seeing and hearing from Reform UK tackles many of these issues. Their policies make sense to me. Common sense. 

I would be pleased to bring my years of experience to bear on our shared difficulties and listen to your problems. I have my feet on the ground and my head is most definitely not in the clouds. I know that all our lives can be made much better now and I want to pass on a far brighter future to our kids than we are presently on track to do.

I believe that it can be done and the choice to roll the dice and take that gamble will be yours come election day. You can choose the same old show or just maybe be brave and give the outsider a fighting chance for once. What have you got to lose? Another lost decade, or a real chance to start fixing the problems with a local representative you can relate too and is really listening.

This is who I am, and I invite you to back me to help Bolsover progress into the 2020s.

Hi everyone.. I am standing for the Green Party, as I believe in social justice and a free Palestine too. If we want real change then we have to vote other parties than the usual main parties. The Green Party has proven that we are no longer a wasted vote by winning Halliwell Ward comfortably!  We can do the same again in Bolton North East.  Let's give Bolton our first Green Party MP and break the Tory & Labour monopoly in UK politics!

My roots and home are in Bolton. I'm raising my family here, and I want to make sure Bolton reaches its full potential.

With a strong track record of campaigning and knocking on doors for the Labour Party, and a history of working on life-changing campaigns for different communities - from our Armed Forces to victims of press abuse - I've got the experience necessary to be Bolton's voice in Westminster. Every time I speak to someone from Bolton they tell me the same story about their pride in our town, and how it's a great place to make a life, but sadly they tell me that the reality is the town has gone downhill in recent years. Bolton is being let down and left behind under the Tories.

I know that Bolton has so much potential and opportunity, and I'm determined to work with our communities, businesses, and local services to make sure Bolton delivers for everyone.

It's time for a change. Let me know if you want to play your part and join the team - I'd love to hear from you.

I live in the ward with my partner and two sons (the youngest is just a month old so I've not been able to be as visible as some as the other candidates lately). This is part of the reason I am so passionate about helping my friends and neighbours make our community the best it can be.

I am a Liberal Democrat because one of their key values is that of empowering local communities. It's not about some faceless politician you've never seen making decisions about an area they may never have visited. I believe in helping people to help themselves so that the right support can be received in the right areas. 

Littering/fly tipping, crime and speeding are some of the key issues that residents have raised to me across the ward. 

Supporting residents with waste disposal is something I am keen to implement as a councillor for our area - I have several ideas around this which I would look to implement, one being a council approved additional waste collector scheme so that residents can have confidence that their waste is being collected and not fly tipped by the waste removal company.

I have personally experienced difficulties in contacting the local neighbourhood officers in relation to local crime issues and I would look to ensure a more open platform for communication with our local police neighbourhood teams. Working together will make the approach to policing more relevant and have a a more positive impact on the relationship between the police and our community.

It was with great sadness that I saw the speed watch scheme, set up by volunteers in the ward, dissolved due to a lack of support. As your local councillor, I would work to try and ensure there is support for such schemes from the police and council as this was such a positive example of local residents taking direct action to improve their own area.

This is just a taste of some of my thoughts on how I could support the community to improve our ward and if there is a specific issue you would like to know more on then please drop me a reply here or send me a message.

I'm Bolton born and bred. My Dad was a paramedic on Belmont Road, and my first job was working for the NHS at Bolton Hospital at a time when the last Labour government made record investment into our health service.

Yet after 14 wasted years, this government has eroded our public services, hollowed-out our town centres and widened inequalities.

It doesn't have to be like this. I have an ambitious, positive vision of a better Bolton West. One where power, wealth and opportunity are shared. Where everyone is able to realise their full potential, regardless of your background.

People across Bolton West deserve so much better. With a Labour MP and a Labour government, I know that together we can tackle the cost-of-living crisis, ensure investment in our towns, fix rising crime and the address the NHS backlog. That's why I want to carry on my family's tradition of public service in Bolton, as your MP.

If elected, I'll work with our local community groups, our councillors and with you to deliver on your priorities. And I'll ensure you have a powerful voice in Westminster.

If you'd like to find out more about me or can spare a few hours to help, please get in touch!

For years our area has been taken for granted by an out-of-touch Conservative Government that has failed to get the basics right and lurched from crisis to crisis - now it’s time for a change. 

Local health services have been brought to their knees, people’s mortgages and rent have skyrocketed and water companies have been allowed to pump their filthy sewage into our rivers and beaches. All this by a Conservative government more interested in fighting between themselves than standing up for the country.

Every vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote for a fair deal. It’s a vote for a party that will stand up for our community and our health services.
From Metro Mayor to Bootle MP

Lincolnshire born Richard is married with two school age children and is a delivery manager in the IT industry. An experienced campaigner, his priorities for Boston & Skegness include ensuring the NHS is properly funded, that residents can access GP appointments, improving educational outcomes, and protecting the area's green spaces and natural habitats. For a fair deal for Boston and Skegness

I'm not your typical politician. I come from a working class family and funded myself through college and university with retail jobs. I spend my professional career working outside politics in the voluntary sector as the chief executive of domestic abuse, mental health, and homelessness services. And I have a track record of delivering large climate infrastructure projects to achieve a green transition. I'm standing for Parliament to stand up for local people and help bring about a better Bournemouth and a better Britain.

Jon first moved to Bournemouth over 30 years ago, and since then his work has taken him all over the world. He is now living in Bournemouth with his family and works in conflict resolution and development projects focused on reducing extremism, visiting communities across the UK.

Jon said: "Bournemouth is taken for granted by a Conservative party that is no longer recognised by many who have previously voted for it. People I speak to are shocked that the Tories are turning their backs on jobs, democracy and even the rule of law. The undeliverable 'Leave' promises made during the referendum mean they have a lot to answer for. This country needs a fresh and honest approach to politics, as a Liberal Democrat I stand ready to demand better for Bournemouth, and better for Britain."

Some of Jon's campaign priorities are to:

- Stop Brexit and save our NHS
- Tackle the climate crisis & support renewable energy
- Improve housing provision and eliminate homelessness
- Ensure the damaging Tory cuts to local schools and colleges are reversed.

Bournemouth is an amazing place, but the vibrant town I remember from my childhood has been let down by more than a decade of neglect by the Conservatives.

I have seen the decline of our high streets and town centre. I have felt the pain of rising energy bills and food costs. NHS waiting times are at record highs, and people like my grandparents have struggled to access quality local social care. Sewage is being pumped into our rivers and seas at an alarming rate. And crime is on the rise. The next election could not be more important. After 13 years of the Conservatives, it's time for change.

I don't come from a political family, but I was taught to value hard work, honesty and public service. Throughout my career, I've worked with businesses, governments and charities to solve problems and get things done. I've campaign on early years education, fair taxation and cost of living support. Now I want to deliver the best deal for people in Bournemouth West.

I believe that together we can win a Labour MP in Bournemouth West for the first time ever - and work to make sure Bournemouth fulfils its potential. I want to see a Bournemouth that builds on its reputation for innovation and creativity, that protects its environment and ensures it is the best possible place to live, work and visit.

Together we can build a brighter future for Bournemouth.

Bracknell deserves better.   For years, the Conservatives have prioritised their interests over those of ordinary people. The Liberal Democrats offer an alternative plan to tackle the cost-of-living crisis, NHS waiting lists, climate emergency and sewage in our rivers.

My diverse experiences, from growing up in Ireland to working as an aid worker in Rwanda, then balancing a corporate career with raising 3 children, have shaped my understanding of our daily struggles and fuelled my determination to find real solutions.   For 6 years, as a local councillor, I've worked tirelessly to challenge Thames Water, revitalise town centres, and fight violence against women and girls.  I am ready to take that work ethic and experience to be a voice that will stand up for Bracknell. If you have any questions for me, please e-mail katie.mansfield@bracknellBibDems.org.uk

I am proud to be standing as Labour’s candidate in Bracknell, Crowthorne and Sandhurst, my home town. Only Labour can beat the Conservatives here, and only Labour will get Bracknell’s future back.   I’m not a career politician. Like my parents, I’ve worked my whole career in education. I’m a university lecturer and school governor, and I advise a national education charity on policy. Before that, I was a school teacher.   I’m standing to be Bracknell’s Labour MP because I want to re-build our public services and help families struggling with the cost of living crisis. After 14 years under the Conservatives, we need change.   I know first-hand what the Tories have done to our schools. We don’t have enough teachers, our kids’ mental health is suffering, and SEND students have been abandoned. On everything from the NHS to public transport, the environment to the cost of living, fourteen years of Tory government have robbed this country of its future.   In Bracknell, Crowthorne and Sandhurst, only Labour can beat the Tories. That’s why I am asking every voter to make a simple choice. More of the same with the Tories, or change with Labour.

I have lived in Bradford most of my life; currently residing in Shipley just inside the Bradford West constituency. I work in central Bradford for a mixed ability sports organisation. I have been employed in community regeneration projects in Bradford and Keighley for over 15 years. I believe that Bradford is a vibrant city with great potential to be a great place to live, work and play; however we need strong leadership to raise the profile of the city regionally and nationally, as we are often overlooked. The Green Party representation locally at council level needs to be broadened to change people's lives for the better.

People in Essex feel significantly less safe than people in England as a whole (Essex County Council data). Nearly half of women and over two-thirds of people aged 18-25 don’t feel safe in Essex after dark. Too many people feel they aren’t listened to when they report things to the police and that nothing gets investigated when they report thefts and vandalism.

I will push for Essex Police to tackle the crimes that affect people’s lives and work with partners to tackle the root causes of crime, such as insecure housing and poor support for our most vulnerable residents. As a Liberal Democrat I am campaigning to fund youth services properly so that we can work with young people to set them on the right path.

The Liberal Democrats have a track record of making Essex safer for women, such as the pioneering Women’s Safety Charter by Lib Dem-led Chelmsford City Council. I want the opportunity to build on initiatives like this.

Rural crime and community policing desperately need more attention. Only 0.1% of police in England and Wales are dedicated to rural crime teams. Essex’s team has only 11 officers which is simply not enough for our needs. Local communities across the county are crying out for more community-focused policing. I am committed to increasing the number of community-based officers, including appropriately trained officers for rural communities.

Our emergency services work hard to protect our lives and wellbeing but they simply aren’t given the resources they need. I will hold the Government to account, advocate for proper funding and give a voice to all Essex residents.

Vote Liberal Democrat on 2nd May 2024 for policing and fire services that work for everyone.

Prepared by J Whitehouse 7 St Johns Road Epping CM16 5DN

A Message from    

David Heather 

Independent Parliamentary Candidate for the Braintree Constituency.

Dear Braintree Constituent,  Thank you in advance for taking the time to read this. Your vote in the up and coming General Election counts. Why? Perhaps for the first time in modern history, the vast majority of people are utterly disillusioned with mainstream politics. Which means that your vote, if used correctly can change the status quo and change the people who govern this country.  

The first thing I should say is that if elected, I will not be taking a salary, instead donating it to local charities of your choice. I now run a small business which provides enough for me to live on without excess, and I believe others less fortunate can benefit.  I have had 40 years of experience in the real world from an assistant in a shop to Finance Director and Managing Director of large and small businesses both in the UK and overseas. I have over the past 6 months, since I decided to stand, listened to many people in the Constituency of Braintree. Many of you may have already had a chat with me, in cafes, pubs, shopping centres or supermarkets. What I have heard in the Constituency is both of concern and hope.  Local issues should always be at the heart of the Member of Parliament that represents you.

I pledge to always make myself available to you all to champion local problems and support local successes. I will support your concerns over excessive immigration. In our Constituency, Wethersfield Asylum camp highlights this problem. I will support an extremely robust approach on both legal and illegal immigration.  I will support measures to reduce the influence of small minorities on public and private life.  I would ensure that the Local Authority are charged with repairing potholes within 24 hours of them being reported and have mobile units travelling up and down all roads spotting and repairing without requiring permission.  I will support banning smart phones and social media for under 16 year olds during school time.  I will support our local NHS and private hospitals, looking for ways to integrate. I will campaign for a local Accident and Emergency facility in the constituency.  I will support our local rural communities, particularly farmers.  On net Zero, I will support a more gradual approach that takes into consideration the cost and benefit of measures put forward.  I would work with other Members to simplify our tax system and reduce taxes, to reduce the wastage in the National Health Service and to improve our defense of the Realm. I will also work to reform the Civil Service to ensure customer focus and reduce political influence at the heart of the Civil Service. 

I represent common sense. 

Democracy is about what the majority want, whilst listening to the views of minorities. It is not about minorities shouting loudly enough that their way is right, so it becomes right.  Thank you for taking the time to read this. If you agree with my Independent views and wish to vote for me then please do or you can ask any questions by emailing me at davidcnheather@hotmail.co.uk I have adopted the slogan BE CLEVER, VOTE HEATHER and you all, courtesy of the Electoral Commission be receiving a leaflet through the post. Please display it in your window and I will try and visit you so that you can put your points across to me personally. I will also be holding meetings in Braintree, Halstead, Wethersfield, Great Yeldham, Sible and Castle Hedingham and be in the town centres of the constituency over the next few weeks.  If you wish to offer support, either physical or financial then please feel free to contact me at davidcnheather@hotmail.co.uk For support in canvasing contact 07425604675 For financial support from £1 upwards please go to https://www.gofundme.com/f/independent-parliamentary-candidate-braintree Published and promoted by David Heather 32 St James Street Castle Hedingham CO9 3EW

Richard served in the military for 8 years as a Royal Marine Commando, completing 2 tours of Afghanistan. Now, he holds a senior position in an international trading computer software firm. Being a very  driven and ambitious person, he now looks to turn this drive into helping the local community and joining the council. Are you fed up with walking into the Grove and finding the bins have overflowed with rubbish? Or walking into the Mill Lane car park and having broken glass all over the floor? Or are you depressed at looking at all the empty shops on the High Street? Like most people, Richard is fed up with the same parties making promises but not providing any real change despite how well intentioned these individuals might be. We need to be innovating as to how the system works and focused on driving real change into how these services can be delivered in order to better serve the local residents.
