1. Creating Jobs

Keep promoting Swindon as a great place to do business, attracting even more skilled jobs to our town, building on the near 60% reduction in local unemployment since 2010.

2. Championing our Local NHS

Help to make sure that the 50% increase in Swindon health spending over the next 5 years is spent on a more co-ordinated and expanded service for local residents.

3. Work for even more investment

Build upon the over £169m investment in local infrastructure that we are receiving by pressing for more improvements to Swindon’s major road network and ensuring that we fully reap the benefits of the ongoing rail electrification.

4. Support our Local Culture and Heritage

Work with local heritage and culture groups to regenerate our historic buildings and showcase our cultural assets. Robert is Patron of the new Lydiard Park Community Trust.

5. Championing Success in Education

Work with local schools and colleges, the Council and the Government to further drive up standards and to give young people the skills they need for their future. 

6. An Approachable, Hardworking and Influential MP

To continue to be a hardworking, visible and approachable MP, visiting residents, holding regular Advice surgeries and making our case at the highest level. 

ROBERT'S CV
BA (Hons) Law (Dunelm) 1990; Called to the Bar, Inner Temple, 1991. Practising Barrister from 1992-2010.  Crown Court Recorder 2009-; QC 2014; Bencher, Inner Temple 2014-; Conservative MP, South Swindon 2010-; HM Solicitor General 2014-

CONSERVATIVES CREATING A COUNTRY THAT WORKS FOR EVERYONE

1. The deficit reduced by nearly three quarters as a share of our economy

2. Income Tax cut for 31 million people

3. Employment increased by nearly 3 million

4. National Living Wage introduced

5. Welfare capped to reward work

6. Record spending on NHS and Mental Health services

7. 1.8 million more pupils are taught in good or outstanding schools

8. Introducing 30 hours per week free childcare for working parents of 3-4 year olds

9. Fuel Duty Frozen

10. 2% of our national income being spent on our defences each year

THERESA MAY’S PLAN FOR BRITAIN

Our Plan for Britain is a plan to get the right deal for Britain abroad and a better deal for ordinary working people at home.

Our Plan for Britain will deliver a country that is stronger, fairer, more united and more outward-looking than ever before.

1. A Global Britain that is outward-looking

2. A stronger economy where everyone plays by the same rules

3. A fairer society where success is based on merit, not privilege

4. A united nation that our children and grandchildren are proud to call home.

GETTING THE RIGHT BREXIT DEAL

We will seek to achieve the right deal for the UK and for the EU

1. Legal certainty and clarity

2. Control of our own laws

3. Strengthen the British Union

4. Maintain the Common Travel Area with Ireland

5. Control of Immigration

6. Rights for EU nationals in Britain, and British nationals in the EU

7. Protect workers’ rights

8. Free trade with European markets

9. New trade agreements with other countries

10. The best place for science and innovation

11. Co-operation in the fight against crime and terrorism

12. A smooth, orderly Brexit

Promoted by Nick Burns-Howell on behalf of Robert Buckland, both of Swindon Conservatives, Suite 14, Unit C, The Dorcan Complex, Faraday Road SN3 5HQ. Printed by www.robertbuckland.co.uk Conservatives

Matt became a councillor for the expanded Bathavon South ward in 2019, alongside Neil Butters. He is proud to be standing again, this time with Fiona Gourley. Matt will continue to work closely with the 13 Parish Councils in the ward, with Fiona, as well as helping individual residents. He has worked in both the public and private sectors, and is a co-founder of Truespeed Ltd. Matt lives in Englishcombe Parish with his family, where he has a heritage apple orchard and a community tree nursery.

The referendum result has completely changed British politics and it’s time for a change in Walsall North. Unlike Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour candidate, I campaigned for leave vote alongside nearly three quarters of voters in Walsall North. I am on your side and want to make that change happen.
 
Now, under the strong leadership of Theresa May, we have an opportunity to shape our future and make a success of Brexit. I want a Brexit that works for everyone in Bloxwich and Willenhall; protecting and creating new jobs across Walsall. I want to take control of immigration, whilst making sure that we can deliver the skills needed to keep our economy and public services strong.
 
I will work with the new West Midlands Mayor, Andy Street, to get more affordable houses built in Walsall North. Owning a home is a dream for many and I support Theresa May’s efforts to help young first-time buyers get on the housing ladder. 
 
More houses need to be built but shouldn’t come at the expense of green spaces around our community. I pledge to work to ensure that old, derelict brownfield sites and empty offices are used to provide new homes. We need a strong economy to deliver and must not allow Jeremy Corbyn to put Walsall’s economy at risk.
 
As the son of a bus driver, I know what it takes to make ends meet. I pledge to work hard and be a strong local MP, championing your needs in Westminster.

Nigel is a serving Parish Councillor in High Legh Cheshire and has lived in High Legh Tatton for 25 years with wife Helen, working as an Insurance Loss Assessor

A Vote for the Green Party is not a wasted vote!

Without you demanding change it will be more business as usual, more oil and gas from the Conservatives and a Labour Party who will not stop it.

This will be your opportunity to influence policy for all, our planet, our environment, a more sustainable future, a fairer society.

Voters are increasingly turning to the Greens because we offer a real alternative, with sensible and practical policies to tackle local and national issues such as the cost of living, the housing crisis, underfunded and run-down public services and the terrible state of our rivers.

“As a Member of Parliament I would oppose the Rwanda Bill and protect vulnerable asylum seekers, support our NHS by properly funding it, and secure the investment necessary to prevent climate catastrophe.

As the appointed Vice Chair of a prominent social housing provider Voice Panel I represent the interests of social housing tenants across the North West, and work to raise standards in the sector.

This has given me a very important insight into the sector and how to improve and support providing much needed safe secure homes going forward.”

After 14 years of decline, the residents of Tatton deserve better. We are all being impacted by the cost of living crisis, our local NHS is struggling, our public transport links are getting worse, our councils are being starved of funding, and our natural environment is being continuously damaged. This cannot go on.



I grew up round here, and want to help improve our area. It was in Cheshire that my parents made their new home after moving from India to work for the NHS. Growing up, as a young carer for my brother, I volunteered at local groups supporting people with learning disabilities. I saw first-hand the impact of Conservative policies on our local families and services. I want to help fix this as Tatton's first Labour MP - and the most local MP Tatton will have ever had.



I fight to support people and businesses every day, as a councillor and Cabinet Member. In my work, as an environmental policy expert, I fight for a more sustainable future, leading a team at an environmental non-profit organisation.



The polls show that Labour can win in Tatton. With my experience and background, policy expertise and local roots, I will serve the residents of Tatton and work to improve people's lives.

I would be a strong MP opposing the Conservatives’ cuts to almost every local school, who will fight the closure of our Norton Manor Camp and speak up for public service, and who will stand for a better world for our children and young people, giving them a stake in the future of our country.

The Conservatives’ chopping the LibDems’ guaranteed annual 2.5% pension increase is also wrong, and their ‘tax’ on the cost of care will mean people will have to give up the value of their home if they suffer from long term conditions like dementia. This is the new hardline Conservative Party and we need an MP to stand up to it – that is my promise to you. I have had my own career and have no interest in the Ministerial greasy pole, my offer is to stand up for you and everyone across this constituency without fear or favour. As more and more of my posters go up people are now flocking to my campaign.  Whichever way they voted in the referendum people know he dangers of the extreme Theresa May/Nigel Farage approach antagonises neighbouring countries. You know that crashing out without a deal would be a serious disaster for trade, jobs and prices right here where we live. I want us to unite around protecting the best of our links abroad. People don’t want to write any Party a blank cheque in this election and know the wisdom of the final deal in two years’ time being subject to a vote by the people, especially by our young people whose lives will be most affected by it.

I will stand up for you against the Government whenever they get things wrong. On protecting our incomes and jobs, our precious environment, our pensions and our care in later life, the Conservatives must not be allowed to make you suffer. We need a strong MP to take them on when it matters, to give opportunities to younger people and secure a better future for our area here in Somerset where I grew up. I will be that strong MP.
 
Published & Promoted by J Fulljames on behalf of Gideon Amos (Liberal Democrats) 83 Staplegrove Road Taunton TA1 1DN.

I believe that politics is something we should do, not something that should be done to us, and I want to bring fairer and greener politics to Taunton and Wellington; working with you to make our towns fit for a sustainable future

Away from the politics, I am a photographer. I am also works at Bridgwater and Taunton College as a photography and media technician at Bridgwater and Taunton College, where I stand as the Just Transition officer for the University and Colleges Union, and also sit on the college climate action committee.

It matters who Priorswood voters choose on May 2nd, and every vote counts. The community needs three committed local representatives working together.

My roots are in Priorswood, and as county councillor in the 1990s I started the North Taunton Partnership which secured the lease for Priorswood’s Community Centre.  I made the case for free-use computers in the library, and have fought to save it from closure in 2011 and 2018. Right now I’m campaigning with other Labour candidates to convince the new council to secure the future of Taunton’s main post office by taking over the franchise. 

These are dark and difficult times for anyone on a limited income. Crucial services have been cut to the bone; too many households are suffering insecurity, hardship, and enforced homelessness. 

My priority is that everything the council does should create a fair, secure and sustainable environment where people from all backgrounds can flourish.

brenda.weston@tauntondeanelabour.org.uk

Alan Adams is a Telford native. Born and bred in Oakengates, he went to local schools, served in the Royal Navy as a Submariner from the age of 17, and then worked as an Engineer in factories across the borough. He understands hard work and has deep roots in our community.

Alan’s Grandad fed the kilns at Blockleys Bricks, his mum worked for the company building the M54, and he remembers Telford town centre when it was not much more than a Carrefour. Alan has also been a proud part of Telford’s growth and evolution. 

As a local business coach he’s supported start-ups and SME businesses to do business better. He’s volunteered for the Princes Trust as a Mentor, and supported his local community – not for personal gain, but because it’s the right thing to do.

Telford deserves a viable alternative to the status quo. A status quo which consists of an unprincipled Labour Council Leader who’s shown repeatedly that he’s in it for the prestige and power, or a little-known replacement Conservative candidate who does not know Telford and can’t be expected to ‘get’ us.

Alan does ‘get’ Telford. Alan’s Telford through and through, and he wants to fight for our town – both inside Westminster and outside. A vote for Alan is a vote for common sense. For values and morals and doing the right thing. It’s a vote for a smaller state, lower taxes, and less red tape. For encouraging and celebrating success. For freedom of speech for all. And for a Britain that’s Great, but that could be so much greater for us all.

Meet Hannah Campbell, a dynamic Conservative activist ready to represent Telford with a vision shaped by her early engagement in activism and dedication to community service. Inspired by volunteering with teens, Hannah is committed to ensuring equal opportunities for all, transcending mere slogans to embody conservatism in action.

For the past decade, Hannah's impact has been evident in the creation of thousands of job opportunities through apprenticeships. Beyond employment, she envisions Telford as a vibrant community with excellent amenities. Committed to continued investment and wise use of funds, she’ll fight for Telford's share of HS2 funding and protect local NHS services.

As a District Councillor for eight years, Hannah safeguards homeownership principles, preventing green belt encroachment and holding management companies accountable. From a family of small business owners, she passionately advocates for economic thriving in Telford, recognising the untapped potential post-Brexit.

In her thirties, Hannah brings fresh perspectives and 15 years of political campaigning experience, vowing to be a relentless advocate for Telford. Her promise is clear: to champion the town, create opportunities, and become the next Conservative MP Telford deserves.

I am proud to be running to represent Tewkesbury community as a Labour Member of Parliament.   I have dedicated my career to making a difference and have a track record of making things happen. I have professional experience of managing large teams and projects as a senior proposal manager in the Health, Technology, Energy, Manufacturing and Finance industry. I received my first degree at the University of Liverpool in Economics and a Masters in Oil and Gas Management at the University of Aberdeen. As a councillor and member of the Children and Young People committee, Business Support commitee and Employee Matters commitee I have helped deliver better outcomes for our children, businesses, housing, and better community facilities. I am a Mother to a 5-year-old SEND child so I  understand the first-hand challenges that parents of SEND children have. In between balancing work, being a mother, in my spare time, I do enjoy pilates, tennis and pottery.    It would be a great honour to be able to use my skills and experience over the years to be the powerful voice our area deserves in Tewkesbury.    

Some issues that I will address if elected: 1. Addressing the cost of living crisis, our families should not be worse off.  2. Ensuring free and timely access to the NHS and dental care, also reducing waiting times making sure residents have access to face to face appointments with their GPs when they need them.  3. Also addressing the housing supply issues in the area, addressing the flooding issues affecting houses and businesses and working with environmental agencies.   4. Prioritising young people especially SEND and encouraging organisations and schools to empower and equip the next generation of leaders.  5. Creating proper clean up squads to take flytipping seriously.  6. Investing back into our high street, helping tourism to boost more business on the high street.

I have lived in Gloucestershire for thirty years where I’m a County, Borough and Town councillor.  Elected / re-elected in 2019 and 2023 to Town and Borough and to County in 2021, I lead groups of four Greens at both Borough and County. I’m an experienced public speaker and my work has given me the extensive range of skills required for Parliament.

I found my way into politics in order to help protect our area and give voice to the strong feelings of residents. I really like helping, solving issues, putting people in touch and making our area a better, safer place to live. The support I have had from residents has been terrific and I am delighted every time I am able to achieve successful results for them. People said that they have felt especially cared for during the pandemic, as I kept them well informed via email and phone calls and I continue to send regular emails and flyers go out throughout the year, (not just at election time!).   I am also delighted that the Green Party are growing locally having increased our number by 300% in the last local elections. 

The Green Party aligns with my lifelong values. I ran for Parliament in 2017 and 2019 so my name is well-known and I’m very committed and I am asked on a daily basis if I’m the candidate again. I’m a firm believer in equality, justice and education; those lucky enough to have been taught to love our planet want to protect it. We need radical Government policy change and support for individuals too; many want to use alternatives to cars, but if there are no transport services or safe roads they cannot.

Alongside the many committees and working groups, I’ve packed much into the last few years, including conferences and courses where it’s good to network and share ideas, plus various trips to Westminster and visits to urban tree schemes, hydrogen businesses, farms, schools, recycling plants, solar panels on Gloucester Cathedral’s roof and more.

Protecting nature is now a high priority for many people; At Borough, I brought two successful Climate Emergency motions, (including an ecological emergency) and I chair the Climate and Ecology working group where a lot takes place, including the installation of a solar PV canopy which generates around 70% of site electricity.

I’m creative and very much enjoy organising and motivating people; From the Wildlife Trust’s 30 days Wild, I devised Tewkesbury Goes Wild, (over 40 free outdoor events, led by experts), I coordinate Tewkesbury’s Toad Patrol, lead a community group and ran a community speed watch, (now waiting for cameras). I also run free monthly Daytime Discos for people to enjoy tea, a chat, make friends, watch dancers, or join in to keep fit, I've set up Tewkesbury Dementia Action Alliance as we were the only Gloucestershire district without one and I am a huge advocate for our brilliant, monthly Repair Café too.

I work extremely hard, receive lots of case work and make positive change, including helping to save 2,000 trees from being felled; a site Tree Preservation Order was secured and I spoke at the appeal which was an amazing community victory. I’ve solved major issues with social housing, reinstated allotments and obtained emergency help for flood victims.

I’m also a musician, love dancing, long walks and locally grown or foraged food. I’m a Trustee of the Roses Theatre and part of the management team of Tewkesbury Nature Reserve.

As Tewkesbury’s Green Party General Election candidate and potential MP,  I will extend my passion, continuing to make this parliamentary constituency a better place for everyone.

Hello, 

I’m Cameron Thomas and I'm your Liberal Democrat Parliamentary Candidate in Tewkesbury Constituency. I first moved here following an assignment at Imjin Barracks in 2016, and settled with my family shortly afterward.

I'm not a career politician, I consider myself to be a public servant. 

I joined the RAF as a teenager in 2000 and served across the world prior to my resignation in 2023, so that I could stand to represent you. My specialisations were communications and information systems, policing and security, training and inclusion. I served on several operational deployments throughout my career, including 3 to Iraq, and to the Falkland Islands. One such deployment was an assignment to East Midlands NHS Trust, as a Military Planner to help issue Covid 19 Vaccines to thousands of residents across Leicestershire. I love and respect our NHS and will fight to protect it. It must be preserved so that help is there when we most need it. Doctors, nurses and staff must be supported and fairly paid.

I'm passionate about laying the foundations for young people to achieve their potential. Key to this is through a fair and well-funded education system; ours needs a complete overhaul and significant investment. It also means preserving our environment and increasing biodiversity. Nature is key to our mental health, and I want our children to enjoy the wealth of different species which we ourselves have enjoyed. I have been a marine conservation campaigner for 20 years and have joined and led expeditions in the Pacific Ocean, North Sea and English Channel. In our constituency, I have engaged with the Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust and look forward to helping them preserve our biodiversity from Westminster if elected.

As a retired Military Police Officer, I am your law and order candidate, but I am driven by compassion, empathy and public service. I will always speak out against injustice and defend others when they need it... it's in my DNA. I hope that my background will convince you that I'll represent you with courage and integrity, because I will. For too long, those who represent us have taken us for granted, voted against our interests, broken the rules they themselves implemented, and then lied to our faces about it. We deserve leaders who'll set a better example. That's why I'm standing.

At this General Election, it's the Liberal Democrats who are best placed to beat the Conservatives. I'd helped campaign with the Lib Dems at the previous election, in which we finished 2nd, some distance ahead of Labour. Since then, our constituency has benefitted by electing more Lib Dem District Councillors at Cheltenham Borough, Tewkesbury Borough and Gloucester City Councils than every other party combined. Our councillors lead all 3 of those councils, and are delivering for residents every day. I am absolutely convinced that the Liberal Democrats are a force for good in UK politics, and are the most environmentally conscious party in the country. I am so proud to stand as their candidate, for you. I am a candidate for our entire constituency, and have been campaigning from Twyning in the North, to Longford in the South, from Apperley in the West, to Winchcombe in the East.

If elected, I pledge to work cross-party to: ✅ Defend our NHS, ✅ Tackle the cost of living crisis, and ✅ Protect our Environment. The Lib Dems have already taken the lead on these issues, where other parties have followed.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about me. You can find more information at my website here: cameronthomas.co.uk.

Please, for change in Tewkesbury, vote for Cameron Thomas and the Liberal Democrats on 4th July 2024.

Cameron Thomas - Standing up for you in Tewkesbury Constituency

As Libdem candidate for The Wrekin on July 4th, I pledge to be a local and listening MP to represent you and your concerns in Westminster.  If you put your trust in me, I will be The Wrekin's man in Westminster, NOT Westminster's man in The Wrekin. Do you follow this important distinction? If so, please support me with your vote. Thank you.

The Wrekin Constituency Green Party Candidate Pat McCarthy.
I have lived in Telford for 30 years and have worked for Community Arts, as a community and environmental officer for a local authority and now as the director of a social enterprise supporting adults with learning difficulties and a community cafe in Wellington. I have a proven record of community activism, chairing College Ward East Residents Association for 4 years promoting the interests of a much neglected part of Wellington. I have been re-elected 3 times as an independent councillor for College Ward believing that it is important and more effectual if you live in the ward you represent. I set up my own party - People First Party because of a deep distrust of the established Parties, which I feel is a universal view.
It was in 2015 that the Green Party's message reached me. They seemed to be the real party of change with radical ideas such as Universal Basic Income, real decentralisation of politics and our economy and a 'people first' rather than 'profits first' solution to some of the profound problems we face, that left me no option but to join them.

I’m delighted to be able to offer people in Thornbury and Yate the chance to vote Green in the next election. We are the only party putting the climate first, but we’re about much more than that, with sensible policies to tackle the cost of living crisis, improve the way housing is delivered, prioritise public transport and build a fairer society for everyone.

Having lived, worked, and raised my children in this constituency, I now want to represent the community to get a fairer deal for everyone and for the planet. Working in a local school gives me a first-hand view on the plight of our public services, and as a volunteer with HomeStart I've seen the impact of austerity on young families.

The Green Party has a strong manifesto and all the ingredients for a brighter political future for our country and I will work hard to communicate that to the people of Thornbury and Yate, in the hope that we can create a sustainable future for everyone.

Councillor Rob Logan is an experienced campaigner and public servant.



With long-standing family connections to the area, Rob represented Labour at the last General Election in Thornbury and Yate, and is looking forward to doing so again. The time has come to remove a tired Conservative Government, and embrace a new, forward-looking Labour programme for government.

I love Billericay. I’ve run my business here for 25 years. Now I’m retiring, I want to support the next generation of small business owners. Local shops and services, not big chains, make our town special - they’re the heart of our community. But they’re struggling, just like businesses across the country. It’s high time we got our house in order and helped them thrive again. I’m thrilled to represent Billericay East as your Green council candidate.

Everyday, I look forward to contributing to this ever inclusive, multinational city called London. I receive a great sense of satisfaction working alongside colleagues from other Countries within our treasured NHS where I work as a Nurse. I get a great sense of security and stability from living in the same area where I was born. I am concerned that future generations may not be so lucky. I will always fight for mixed, sustainable communities. These cultural exchanges has enhanced my life and adds immense value to our Nation. I am a Liberal because I believe in a fair, free and open society. I want to make London equal.  I want to make London Liberal.

I am a former civil servant who was born and brought up in Thurrock and I am now raising my family here. I am an unpaid carer for my daughter, a community volunteer and am a passionate campaigner for disability rights.

I am truly honoured to be Labour's candidate for my home here in Thurrock. Our community have been hit hard by the Tories failures. They've bankrupted our council, we have some of the worst GP waiting times in the country and some of the worst levels of air pollution outside of London. Everyone here is feeling the pinch of the cost of living crisis, while the Tory Government prioritise resolving their own internal squabbles over running the country.

I am determined to be a champion for Thurrock and for the people living here. I look forward to hearing from people in Thurrock what they want to see from a Labour Government and having conversations about how they will see a real positive change with Labour for both our community and our country.

Born and raised in the West Midlands, I read Law and French at Aberystwyth University, completed the Legal Practice Course in Bristol, before coming home to begin my career as a lawyer.  

I was raised in a single parent family, and watched my Mum balance numerous jobs, whilst bringing up two children on her own.  I know first-hand how hard it is to make ends meet, and my own experiences growing up pushed me into politics, determined to ensure that everyone, no matter what their background can achieve their fullest potential.  

The Labour fiefdom in Sandwell has sold out the communities of Wednesbury, Tipton, Oldbury and Tividale for far too long, overlooking investment and ignoring residents. I am determined to change this by fighting for more investment, opposing reckless developments, securing more jobs and sorting out our traffic problems.   Together I know we can achieve the best for our community.

I'm honoured to have been chosen as Labour's candidate for my home constituency of Tiverton and

Minehead.



Generations of my family have lived in Somerset. I was raised here and this is where I will raise my

children.



For far too long our communities have been neglected and ignored. In 2010 the Conservative and

Liberal Democrat coalition Government gave us austerity; a political choice that caused huge damage

locally and nationally. This damage has continued to this day. Now, 14 years later, we have seen the

decimation of local transport, health and social care provision and education.

Inequality is rising and costs are soaring. It does not have to be like this.



As a teacher I have seen this decline first-hand and that's why I am standing to be your next MP.

Labour's missions for a better Britain will transform our communities for everyone. I am proud to be

campaigning on these transformative plans, to support our rural economy and bring back fairness and

opportunity for all.



Our areas of Devon and Somerset deserve to have a strong voice in a transformative Labour

government. Someone who will truly work for them. I promise that I will listen to you, stand up for

you and be a hard working, visible and easy to contact MP....after all an MP is for the whole of the

year not just General Elections.



· Vote positively.

· Vote for change.

· Vote for policies.



Only a vote for Labour guarantees a change of Government.



To find out more about Jonathan and how you can help the campaign follow the links on here, at the

top or below.

For more than half my life, I’ve been lucky enough to call this new constituency my home. I spent my childhood in Taunton Deane and since 2006 my family and I have lived in Bampton, which I am proud to represent as Lib Dem district councillor.

I’ve visited every corner of the constituency, our towns and villages, our coast, countryside and moorland, and have a thorough understanding of our many strengths – and the challenges we face.

When it comes to my professional skills, my time as both a director of the NFU and head of strategy at the Environment Agency lend me crucial experience in our rural constituency, and my volunteer experience with the Exmoor Foundation for Integrated Health Care has given me invaluable insight into community health care.

As a politician and a working mother, I’ve mastered many important skills. I love the fun and camaraderie of the campaign trail, and know how to keep people’s spirits up. I always treat my opponents with courtesy and respect, and I’ve never been afraid of speaking truth to power. I have a thick skin, a warm heart and I’m absolutely passionate about bringing a visible local representation to my long-ignored community.

I'm happy to have been selected to stand up for the people of Tonbridge, I've worked minimum wage jobs in the public sector and know what it's like to have to fight for fair pay.



The people of Tonbridge have an MP who has stood idly by as Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak have destroyed our nation's economy, stability and reputation abroad. As Tonbridge's MP I'll be standing up for hard working residents, and commuting into the constituency every day not living in a Westminster bubble.

party_name: Plaid Cymru - The Party of Wales

statement_to_voters:
I am delighted to have been reselected by local Conservatives to stand again for an area which is my home and where I have lived with my family and brought up my children for twenty years.

It is a profound privilege to have represented Torridge and West Devon for the past 14 ½ years, and I am deeply grateful for the kindness and strong support that so many thousands of local people have given me in that time.

I am determined to go on serving and protecting our communities and to support a new Conservative Government that is committed to an economic plan that enables us to level up Devon’s schools’ funding by a record amount so that every Devon schoolchild will benefit from the advantages enjoyed in many other parts of the country, build new hospitals in Barnstaple and Derriford and invest in better broadband connectivity and new rail and road links to serve our rural market towns and villages.

That is why we must get Brexit done now to move on to these urgent priorities.

Alan is a single issue candidate - with focus on "Fair Votes".

A primary obstacle to higher standards in UK public life is the FPTP voting system  (First Past the Post) that offers quite perverse incentives to those elected.  It must be eradicated. Our system needs fundamental alteration.

Alan is asking electors to read his leaflet (available from alanr555@gmail.com)  before voting - and  to use their votes to promote the long-term future of our democracy. He is not promoting any specific party, candidate or system.

Casting votes is simple but in 2019 over 70% were ineffective. We can do better!

As a working person with my own business in the village I grew up in just outside Tavistock and a proud Labour councillor in West Devon, I believe in security for jobs, health, pensioners, the environment, and our country. I’m running for parliament because I’ve seen how London isn’t delivering for us locally, and I want to change that. I’ve done it at a ward level, now I am committed to listening, working, and delivering for our constituency on what matters to you. From taking action on potholes to holding South West Water accountable for polluting our rivers and seas.

We’re a long way from London and I want to be your local seven-day-a-week MP in government. As your MP I will:

1. Keep It Green Get the water bosses to clean up the sewage in our water, make them criminally liable, and ban their bonuses.

2. Get Us Connected HS2 money should be for spent on our railways, not our potholes. I will to stand up for us in parliament to get our towns railways reinstated and buses that are on time.

3. A Fair NHS for Us We have lost our local hospitals, dentists, and doctors, making us travel and pay more. Labour founded the NHS and as your Labour MP I will fight to get the NHS back on it’s feet in Torridge and Tavistock.

4. Homes not Ghost Towns Our towns, villages, and parishes are at risk of being deserted if we don’t build or utilise housing to meet local needs. I want everyone to have a home and I will do everything I can to bring secure and affordable housing to local people.

5. Roads not Holes It’s the 21st century yet we have roads from the 19th because of government cuts. I’ll be championing the fair share we need for our roads and working people. Devon has the largest county road network, now it’s time to get the funding to match.

6. Learning for Life Education and skills training shouldn't be a luxury, it’s a necessity. A tenth of the money has gone from Devon schools since 2010, I want to get that back for our children, teachers, businesses, and future.

7. Pounds in Your Pocket Every penny counts. I know this and you know this. I will work to get the deals we need for our businesses and farmers, to sell our great products across the world, so we can get the prosperity we need to have more money in our pockets.

Ruth Gripper was born and raised in Cornwall. She grew up in Perranwell in the heart of the constituency and went to the village school along with her brothers and older sister. Her dad was a GP in Devoran and Chacewater for thirty years, and her mum was also a GP and later worked at St Julia’s Hospice.

Ruth has a track record of public and community service through her career in the charity sector. At the NHS Confederation she worked with hospital trusts, charities and patient groups on issues facing the health service. She went on to work in a range of roles in the charity sector, working with charities and funders to help improve what they do.

Ruth lives in Perranwell and works for the university, based at the Knowledge Spa at Treliske Hospital. Her role involves bringing small businesses together with university researchers to support innovation, particularly around issues affecting work and health.

Why Ruth is standing for election
“The UK is at a crossroads and what happens in the next few weeks and months will affect all of us and how our country is seen around the world.

“Three quarters of people think that our political system is broken. Too many people feel that they have no way of making themselves heard and no real representation in Westminster where all the major decisions affecting our lives are made.

“I want to change that. Cornwall has been let down by its Conservative representatives. I think things can be better, and that’s why I’m standing as a Liberal Democrat to represent my home constituency.”

Ruth’s priorities are:

averting a disastrous No Deal Brexit
tackling the climate crisis for future generations
working for a fairer funding deal for Cornwall

There is so much to be done in Truro and Falmouth, from working to build the green economy and create the jobs that Cornwall needs, to cleaning up our rivers and seas.

I live and work in the constituency having moved here 18 years ago when I married a naval pilot. Before that, I worked for a number of years as a solicitor representing working people who had accidents at work or employment claims.

As a single parent in Cornwall I put my legal skills to use at Cornwall Citizens Advice and then worked as a teaching assistant at Falmouth Secondary School for seven years while my son was in school.

I stood for Parliament for the first time in Truro and Falmouth in 2017 when we tripled the Labour vote here and made It a Conservative/Labour marginal constituency. I am now Labour Group Leader on Cornwall Council and also sit on Falmouth Town Council. Notable successes include proposing & pushing through Cornwall Council's Climate Emergency declaration, forcing a budget amendment to provide £3.5 million for mental healthcare for our young people in schools and shaping and campaigning on housing policy, which is such a vital issue in Cornwall.

My priorities for Truro and Falmouth are:

1\. The new Green Economy and decent, well-paid jobs that Cornwall needs and deserves.

2\. Tackling Cornwall's housing crisis.

3\. Saving and rebuilding Cornwall's NHS and social care.

I am working hard to be the next MP for Truro and Falmouth, so that I can be a strong and effective advocate for Cornwall in Westminster.

Hugo is a local candidate, having lived in Tunbridge Wells for 32 years. A chartered psychologist, he worked in the NHS, local government, industry and consulting. He is Leader of the Labour Group of Councillors on Tunbridge Wells Borough Council and, since 2022, Cabinet member for Housing & Planning. His voluntary work includes 16 years as a governor at two local schools and supporting his local food larder

Munira Wilson is an experienced senior businesswoman with a professional, political and social track record, living in Whitton.

Munira has lived in Twickenham since 2005, and now lives with her husband and young family in Whitton. Munira is a former Twickenham councillor who helped to secure road safety improvements, tackle crime and anti-social behaviour and worked to protect the local environment.

Munira is campaigning to stop Brexit and for more investment in public services, including more funding for our schools and more police on our streets. She also believes we need urgent action to tackle the climate emergency which is threatening our very existence.

Locally, Munira will continue to champion local people’s concerns by opposing Conservative plans for a third runway at Heathrow and improving air quality, holding South Western Railway and Network Rail to account over poor service and inaccessible stations and helping to tackle the Special Educational Needs and Disability (SEND) funding crisis.

Munira currently works as Corporate Affairs Director for a science and technology company leading on Brexit and health policy for the last three years. She has previously worked for health and children’s charities, as well as the NHS, and holds a modern languages degree from Cambridge University.

Munira is proud to represent her home seat, which includes Twickenham, Teddington, the Hamptons, St Margarets and Whitton. Twickenham is always a straight fight between the Liberal Democrats and the Conservatives. Labour have not had a councillor elected for over 20 years and they've never had an MP here.

I’m proud and honoured my campaign is supported by Unite  Newcastle Hospitals Branch, of which I am a member. We  believe our members are the most suitable people to provide  working class political representation in our interests.

A Voice for Positive Change

As a 23-year-old autistic, queer mother managing chronic health conditions, I understand firsthand the challenges faced by many. My personal journey has fueled my passion for social justice, and I believe I can deliver real change that benefits our people and our country. 

I am excited to stand as the Green Party candidate for Tynemouth, bringing a unique perspective shaped by lived experiences. In roles like youth councillor, YoungMinds youth panellist, and school governor, I have honed skills in public speaking, policy analysis, and community engagement. I have effectively advocated for young people and driven positive change.

Committed to Our Community

My commitment to equitable policies aligns with our community's values. Having faced economic hardship, homelessness, disability and so many other things alike myself, I genuinely understand the issues impacting many constituents. I'm not just advocating for change from an abstract position - I have lived these realities. 

My platform focuses on renationalising public services, equitable education, fair wages, sustainable development, and robust community engagement. These are necessary steps towards an inclusive, healthy, and prosperous society for all. To demonstrate my dedication, I pledge to donate £250 of my monthly salary to community support initiatives.

A Diverse Voice in Politics

What makes me well-suited for politics is my diversity of perspective as a young, autistic, queer individual managing chronic conditions. I bring much-needed representation to the political arena. With a proven track record in advocacy and leadership roles, I have the skills to navigate complex issues and uplift diverse voices.

I pride myself on transparency, openness, and authenticity. You can count on me to maintain this candor, ensuring constituents remain informed and involved in decision-making processes.

My Priorities:

* Social Justice and Equality: Inequality pervades housing, healthcare, education, safety, and well-being. Too many struggle to afford basic needs like food, energy bills, and are living in unsuitable accommodation - especially families and disabled individuals. Marginalised groups face heightened risks of hate and crime. I will work tirelessly to reduce inequality and improve living conditions for all.

* Environmental Sustainability: Protecting our environment is crucial. I will enhance biodiversity, plant more trees for climate resilience, implement effective sewage solutions for cleaner waterways, and help our community reach 99% renewable energy usage. Sustainable practices combat climate change for a livable future.

* Community Health and Wellbeing: Good health and wellbeing are vital for a thriving community. I will prioritise mental health support, create a sense of safety and belonging, ensure accessible healthcare, and advocate for policies upholding dignity like fair wages and universal basic income, as well as expanding community activities, spaces and services that tackle social isolation, mental health challenges, and crime.

Thank you.

 Published and promoted by Ian Appleby on behalf of Chloe-Louise Fawcett Reilly (North Tyneside Green Party), both at 114 Links Road, Cullercoats, NE30 3EA.

Hello residents of the constituency of Tynemouth.

I have lived in North Shields all my life. We live in a wonderful part of the country, but we desperately need a change from the old parties, that have let us down again and again.

Iam delighted to be standing for The Heritage Party in this election to make the change we need to restore our nation. Some of our priorities for Parliament are:

CONTROL OUR BORDERS. Mass, rapid immigration is out of control. We need to stop the boats and reduce net immigration to sustainable levels. The Heritage Party will push back illegal boats back to France. We will place strict caps on work and student visa's while training our own young people up to do the jobs that need to be done in this country.

NO NET ZERO. We will end the war on cars and carbon based energy. We say no to low traffic neighbourhoods, clean air zones, 15 minute cities and the coming ban on petrol and diesel cars. We will ensure we have cheap, reliable, continuous energy from coal, oil, gas and nuclear, to keep the lights on and power our business and industry. 

PROTECT OUR CHILDREN. Comprehensive Sexuality Education has been introduced by the Tories in England, Labour in Wales and the SNP in Scotland. School children are now being exposed to appalling lesson content that confuses them about gender, undermines traditional family values and encourages sexual experimentation. The Heritage Party will ban these lessons and make it illegal to sexualise children. Let kids be kids.

party_name: Alliance - Alliance Party of Northern Ireland

statement_to_voters:
I was born at Hillingdon Hospital in 1988 -- growing up in South Ruislip and Ruislip Manor. I went to local schools. My family have called Uxbridge & South Ruislip their home for generations. I'm here, ready to work hard to improve the area who made me who I am today. Raised by a single parent, my life was shaped by early struggle and poverty. It was my first experience of homelessness, that drove me to join the Labour Party when I was a teenager. Losing our home, when I was 15, forced my mother and I to leave the area -- but Ruislip is where my roots are.

I believe everyone has a right to a decent home. No one should not be able to afford to eat or heat their home. More and more families are now struggling because of the Conservative government's economic mismanagement over the last 14 years. Now we need change. Over almost a decade I've put my principles into practice. Through my nine years as a local councillor and cabinet member I've been finding solutions to tackle low pay, deliver new council homes and good work.

Now, as times get even tougher for families, I am determined to make fundamental change possible in Parliament. As a full-time local MP, I would work hard for a new hospital and better public services. Work tirelessly to deliver a stable and growing economy so that families feel hopeful about the future and to ensure we have more police on the street and safer communities.

I want to make people believe and trust in politicians again. For too long I feel the electorate has been taken for granted and ignored. Politicians work for the people, not the other way around.  Being ex-Army, I’m pro armed forces and emergency services. I believe in this country and its  future and want to help make the UK a better place to live.
I am the coordinator of Hillingdon Green Party, an anti war activist and clean water campaigner. Having a Green voice in Hillingdon Council can make a real difference.

My message is simple – the current government is not working in your best interest. Our NHS is in peril, ambulances take far too long to reach emergency cases, police forces have been so budget-starved that they have had to rely on known sex offenders within their ranks. This is just the start of the list of problems with the current government. 

Unfortunately the system at the moment doesn’t work. Our democracy is broken, because it almost always boils down to a choice between Conservative and Labour, both of which have very similar manifestos and both of which are currently committed to keeping this broken system. I firmly value the idea of democratic representation. That means that I want your votes to actually determine the amount of power a party has.

Please could I personally ask all the people in the vale of glamorgan to lend me their vote for real change in Wales and our wonderful community. We have had 26 long years of labour controlled government that has made us poorer as a people. The waste of money is colossal for one example the local airport which has cost hundreds of millions in losses. Wait until he rolls out his railway project. Wales needs investment however with a left wing government that will never happen so they need to go which will give a signal to the world that we are open for business. Result more jobs better pay better conditions. Please good people of the vale don't be duped by plaid or labour as it's more of the same

party_name: Plaid Cymru - The Party of Wales

statement_to_voters:
Diolch am ymweld. I'm Kanishka, Labour's Parliamentary Candidate in the Vale of Glamorgan.

I am a Barry resident, raised in Cardiff, who witnessed a Labour government's impact from Westminster firsthand: the dawn of a minimum wage, a boost in funding for education and healthcare, an economy going in the right direction.

Part of a new generation in politics, I am standing to undo the damage of thirteen years of Conservative government. My priorities are getting the basics right -- good local jobs, safer neighbourhoods, our community first. At its core, I believe that, together, we can make a brighter tomorrow for the Vale.

Ymunwch â mi!

I'm thrilled and honoured to be representing the community that I love. For too long, huge swathes of the Vale of Glamorgan have been ignored by the major parties, who seem to only care about their own voter base. Voters are fed up with a moribund Conservative Party in Westminster that doesn't care about them, a complacent Labour Party that's been in charge for a quarter of a century in Cardiff and has achieved very little, and an independence-at-all-costs Plaid Cymru that's hell-bent on spending taxpayers' money on a hugely expensive referendum. 

Only the Liberal Democrats offer a truly progressive, inclusive, vision for our country: one where power isn't concentrated by a cabal of politicians, but is truly in the hands of the people. If elected, I vow to represent every single person in the Vale of Glamorgan - whoever they are, wherever they're from and whoever they voted for.

I am delighted to be standing as your Green candidate for Vauxhall and Camberwell Green.

We Greens demand real change for the people we represent. Having Greens in any room makes the other parties lift their game and work smarter and harder for their communities.

Greens work hard for their constituents and we aren't whipped so can really represent the views of residents. Voting Green is never a wasted vote, more crosses in the ballot box shows that Green policies are important and supported!

As a lifelong Brixton resident, I know the issues in this community because I am from this community. Vauxhall faces so many challenges and yet has so much potential. Our public services are at breaking point, we are in the midst of a climate emergency and Brexit continues to divide our community. Knife crime has become an epidemic but we cannot allow ourselves to accept this at the norm. I will be a strong local campaigning voice on issues that matter to residents. I will make myself accessible and available in every corner of the constituency all year round.

It’s a true honour to have been selected as the Liberal Democrat candidate for Vauxhall and Camberwell Green. Vauxhall and Camberwell Green is my home. It is where my charity was founded and where my small local business is based. We have some of the most diverse and vibrant communities in London; communities I am proud to be part of. I could not be prouder to now represent these communities as a parliamentary candidate. 

Too many people are still being adversely affected by the cost of living crisis. Too many people are being let down by low quality housing. Too many people do not have a say on the issues that affect them. These are real and genuine concerns raised by the many Vauxhall and Camberwell Green residents I speak with. 

Vauxhall and Camberwell Green needs a liberal voice to counter the negative effects of an out of touch national government, and to campaign locally against the maladministration of the local Labour party. We need an MP that can stand up for Vauxhall on both of these fronts.

Simon Lightwood is the Labour MP for Wakefield. He was elected in the by-election held on, 23 June 2022 following the resignation of the disgraced Conservative MP Imran Ahmad Khan.

In Parliament, he has campaigned on a wide range of issues, including bus services, NHS dentistry and antisocial behaviour in line with the priorities he set out in his election campaign.

In October 2022, he was asked to join the Shadow front bench, as a Shadow Transport Minister, which includes responsibility for buses.

He is a member of the APPG for Rugby League and a proud Wakefield Trinity fan.

Prior to being elected, Simon was a proud NHS worker and was previously a Labour councillor and cabinet member for public health.

He studied theatre acting at Bretton Hall College in Wakefield.

Simon lives in Wakefield with his husband and their two young children.

I will stand up for the ordinary working class men and women of Wakefield. Overcoming adversity and battling the demons I’ve made a success of my life when I could have fallen into a life of crime. I’m here to give something back.

Vicky lives in Bromborough and has done for 11 years.

She moved here after securing a graduate job in Cheshire. She now works as a Support worker in Wirral.

Vicky joined the Liberal Democrats in June 2017 just before the snap general election.

After years of being a floating voter, she became sick of the ping pong between the ‘big two’ and it became apparent that they are two sides of the same coin.

Vicky made a change and joined the Liberal Democrats with a view to change perceptions of politics as a whole.

“I am not a political animal, I am just a normal person who is sick of the current system. Come join me and make a change.”

I've been  a life-long environmentalist and Cheshire and Wirral’s official bird recorder.  She is also a passionate campaigner for social justice within a National charity. :  Wallasey needs real hope and real change. Hope that a better future is possible and change that will end the cost-of-living crisis, stop sewage polluting our rivers and coasts and create a jobs-rich green economy.

Voting for me sends a clear message to those who have taken your support for granted for decades that the people of Wallasey deserve better.

The only wasted vote is a vote for something you don't believe in.  If you want Green vote Green.”

Rt Hon Valerie Vaz MP was elected MP for Walsall South in May 2010 and re-elected in May 2015; June 2017 and December 2019. Valerie was appointed as Shadow Leader of the House (October 2016 - May 2021). Valerie is a member of USDAW.

Valerie is a solicitor and in Parliament has served on the Health Select Committee 2010-15, Regulatory Reform Committee 2010-15 and House of Commons Governance Committee 2014-15; After the 2015 election Valerie served on the Environment, Food and Rural Affairs 2016, Science & Technology 2015-16 Select Committees and appointed by The Speaker to the Panel of Chairs June 2015-16. Valerie is currently a member of the UK-EU Parliamentary Partnership and NATO Parliamentary Assembly. While in Parliament Valerie has published reports on Obesity and Diabetes Programmes in England: Capturing the State of Play in July 2011, 0845 telephone numbers; Instruments on Planes and a Glossary of Climate Change.

Before becoming an MP, Valerie was a Councillor in the London Borough of Ealing from 1986-90 and contested Twickenham in 1987 and the European Elections in 1999 (East Midlands List).

In October 2019 Valerie was appointed a member of HM Most Honourable Privy Council and received a Hon Doctor of Laws from the University of West London.

My track record as our local MP shows I know how to make change happen. In 14 years, I've personally helped thousands of local people. Whether taking on payday lenders, fighting for women's rights, helping widows or tackling rogue landlords, I've fought for a better future for everyone in Walthamstow. I ask for your vote so I can continue to champion our community and our causes.

*Socialist Nancy Taaffe to stand in Walthamstow constituency*

Millions will relish the opportunity to register their hatred of the Tories at the ballot box. But Keir Starmer and Stella Creasy’s Labour Party doesn’t fight for the interests of working class people. 

Socialist Party member Nancy Taaffe will stand as part of the Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition (TUSC).

* Private profit out of our NHS  * Council homes and rent control  * End austerity - inflation-proof pay rises and no more cuts to jobs and public services  * Renationalise rail, mail, water and energy * Stop the onslaught on Gaza  * For a socialist alternative to capitalist crisis, climate destruction and war

For interview: Nancy Taaffe 07786 857673

* Nancy Taaffe won 5,595 votes in the 2024 Greater London Assembly election and 9% of the vote in the Higham Hill council by-election in October 2014  * TUSC did not contest the parliamentary elections when Jeremy Corbyn was leader of the Labour Party, but Nancy was the Socialist candidate in Walthamstow in 2015 and 2010.  * Nancy and TUSC have consistently stood candidates in Waltham Forest council elections, securing 3,490 votes in 2022, 2,841 votes in 2018 and 5,482 votes in 2014. * Nancy Taaffe is Chair of the Save Our Square campaign and Assistant Secretary of Waltham Forest Trades Council. She and the Socialist Party have a long record of fighting for council housing, and against cuts, privatisation and war.

Having been a Parish, and Borough councillor, it's now time to take the big step to Westminster. I really got into politics over local campaigns - saving the library, challenging decisions in the town, but so much that shapes our lives locally comes from Parliament, and it's not right to criticise, if you won't step up. So here I am - I'll work hard for the Town I call home, and just need you to trust me with your vote.

Warrington South is my home. It's where I live and where I'm raising my family.

I care very deeply about Warrington and all our communities. As a local councillor and Cabinet Member for Children, I've spent years working alongside local residents, businesses, schools, charities and others to deliver for our town.

Warrington is a great place to live but not everyone has a fair chance to succeed; not only to survive, but to thrive. In Warrington South we're stuck without a voice in Westminster. Saddled instead with a Tory 'yes man' who delivers nothing but claims credit for everything.

Times are tough right now. The Tory cost of living is biting hard. Public services have been stripped to the bone. Wages are not keeping up with inflation. Our NHS is undergoing managed decline. The Tories have damaged our country. Hurt our communities. Neglected our region.

But we're fighting back. In Warrington South we're building a united, people-powered campaign - to return a Labour MP to Westminster and a Labour Government to Downing Street - so that we can finally get the change we so desperately need.

Get in touch and get involved. Together, we'll take the fight to the Tories and we will win Warrington South for Labour.

I have called Warwick and Leamington my home for more than 20 years, during which time I have had an opportunity to help people in our towns through various volunteering roles. My goal has always been to have a positive influence, whether it is by serving hot meals to the elderly and disabled, educating students about political processes and environmental issues, organising events like the UK Parliament Week, or standing up for women's rights as a WSO trustee. My transition into politics was an organic extension from community service to a position where I can influence policy changes. Since winning a seat on the district council, I've had the honour of helping Myton and Heathcote Ward residents with various issues. Now, I want to take my commitment to the next level by becoming a strong green voice for Warwick and Leamington in Westminster. I am determined to hold the government to account on critical issues such as the privatisation of NHS services, the lack of proper insulation in our homes resulting in higher energy bills, the cost of living crisis, and the ongoing climate and ecological crises. The people of Warwick and Leamington deserve a hardworking and an effective representative at Westminster, and I am committed to being that advocate.

Working for You I believe in prioritising the needs and concerns of the community above all else. With a strong focus on people before politics. I am dedicated to creating positive change and serving the people of The North East and the United Kingdom. To that end I am proud to be standing as the Reform UK candidate in the first North East Regional Mayoral election to be held this May. I am not your " Typical career politician " that`s for sure, and that is what we need in the North East, someone who will put people before politics. I got involved with politics because I wanted to improve the lives of those around me, you can help me with that aim, We can improve the lives of everyone in the North East together.

It is an honour to represent Washington and Sunderland West constituency as your Labour Party Member of Parliament (MP) in the House of Commons.

Alongside our Labour Councillors, I work hard to ensure that everyone in our area has access to the support and help they need.

Whether it is helping constituents when the benefits system has let them down; supporting local businesses or backing local campaigns, like the campaign against a gasification plant being built in Hillthorn Park, I always act with the best interests of everyone in Washington and Sunderland West in mind.

The Labour Party has not been in government since 2010. Since then, we've seen successive Conservative Governments devastate the economy, our region and household incomes.

This has only been made worse by poor choices from the Tories who have overseen the mismanagement of the Brexit deal, consistently acted against the interest of the country throughout the Coronavirus pandemic, and now during the devastating and spiralling cost of living crisis, are unable to get a grip on the economy and are unwilling to help those who most need it.

I will continue to hold this Conservative Government to account, to protect and improve your livelihoods and our local communities, trying to ensure nobody is left behind.

Labour's priorities will be the priorities of the British people: that starts with economic growth to provide the security our country needs to then rebuild Britain, so that it is the best country to grow up in, and the best to grow old in.

Married for 18 years to a Watford girl born and bred - Dean’s ties with Watford are strong. And, with his daughter born in Watford General Hospital along with family having lived in the area for over 130 years he fully understands both the positives and negatives of life in the area. 

Coming from a working-class background, Dean has experienced a diverse education and career. Gaining a Physics and Business Studies degree BSc(Hons) and an MPhil in Physics and Material Science, he then saw a career in senior positions advising global brands, CEOs, government and philanthropists. 

He also runs his own presentation and pitch business “Win That Pitch” where he advises start-ups and small businesses and was appointed as a start-up mentor in 2018 by London & Partners as part of their Business Growth Hub. 

He has also lectured at multiple universities around the UK and has been appointed as a lecturer for the Institute for Direct & Digital Marketing and as an adjunct lecturer at Ashridge Business School. 

Dean has been a regular commentator on communications, especially in social media, digital and new technologies. This includes writing columns, articles and press interviews for publications including the Health Service Journal and Third Sector magazine. 

He was also a founding Vice Chair for NHS Healthspace, which was the first initiative to investigate allowing patients to access their Summary Care Records directly online.

Most recently he has been interviewed on television news channel Indus International News and in print for The Economist. 

Having travelled widely around the globe managing teams in business across Europe, Middle East & Africa, Dean has also performed charity missions in the Philippine jungle and helped give the gift of hearing to children in a deprived area of Manila with the Starkey Hearing Foundation. He also supported a Basket Brigade to provide food and gifts for struggling families at Christmas in London. 

Dean is no stranger to the world of politics. He is a former St. Albans District Councillor during which time he led a significant reform to create a Health & Wellbeing Partnership.

Working for Watford, Ian has led multiple campaigns to restore cut transport services, protect the Abbey Line rail link, maintain and improve local roads and green spaces and petitioned against local cuts from county council.

Born in Petts Wood, Bromley, Ian Stotesbury attended Ravenswood School before studying Physics and Astrophysics at the University of Birmingham. He grew up in a safe Conservative seat before moving to Birmingham where he first experienced active campaigns, outraged at the complacency so often seen in safe seats. After completing his degree in Physics he attended Cranfield University to study a degree in Astronautics and Space Engineering.

Ian is a passionate scientist, engineer and environmentalist. In his role as a Systems Engineer in the Space Industry he works on the design of spacecraft. He has been involved in the manufacture, test and launch of a number of spacecraft for both public and private customers.

The motivation for Ian to enter politics is to represent Watford as a hardworking but above all approachable MP for its constituents and be a voice for evidence based policy. He believes in government transparency and openness. He pledges to work tirelessly for Watford and the UK’s interest and set a new standard for approachability and accountability in parliament with highly regular updates of ongoing work, policy decisions and surgeries.

Matt has lived in Watford since 2011 and was elected to the council in 2012. In 2015, Matt was Labour's candidate for Watford in the general election and took Labour from third place to second. He currently works in health and social care and previously worked at the BBC.

Dr Gurpreet Padda (she/her) has today 20th March 2024 been selected as parliamentary candidate for Waveney Valley.



As an environmental scientist, Gurpreet is committed to working hard in the area of environmental science and conservation. She has worked at the Centre for Environment Fisheries and Aquaculture Science (Cefas) lab in Lowestoft and is working in government, and completed her PhD in Environmental Sciences at the University of East Anglia. Gurpreet is founder of Black Ocean Citizens, a non-profit aimed at connecting diverse and underrepresented communities to water-based and ocean sciences. As well as working in Norwich, she also serves Lakenham ward as Norwich City Councillor and is involved in decisions concerning the provision of affordable housing, tackling crime, equality & diversity, climate change and creating opportunities for local training and employment.



With ties across Waveney Valley, Norfolk and Suffolk, Gurpreet lives in Norwich with her husband, two children and Luna the dog. Daughter of first generation immigrants, Gurpreet understands the value of hard work and being part of a community. She enjoys listening to music, spending time with her family and friends outdoors and on the river, fishing.



Gurpreet says "I am aware of challenges facing the Waveney Valley community including poor services as a result of dwindling public finance and not having enough low carbon affordable homes to support growing local families. With Labour marked as the succeeding party, no other candidate can and will ensure local voices are heard in Parliament."



"I am excited to be representing Waveney Valley. With Labour in government, I want to be a strong advocate for local people in Westminster. Issues that are important to me are:



Cleaner -- As part of Labour's Clean Energy goals, hold water companies to account to ensure Good Environmental Status is achieved regarding the health of River Waveney

Greener -- With Labour's Green Prosperity and Great British Energy plans, mandate for low carbon affordable new homes to support local jobs and services



Fairer -- As part of Labour's modern childcare system, support local families with child care to enable families to stay local with better paid, good quality jobs, and low carbon affordable new homes."

I am Norfolk born and bred, and still live here with my fiancée and two primary school age children. I was one of the first in my family to go to university, at UEA; I am Leader of the Green Party; I’ve been a senior lecturer; and for the last decade, a national charity chief executive. I am standing, not to gain power, but because I care deeply about this area and improving people’s lives. I will do what’s right for constituents and won’t be told how to act and vote by a party. 

After 14 years of Conservative government, nothing seems to work and public services are being hollowed out. I won’t over-promise what I can achieve as an individual MP. But I can promise that I will campaign - inside and out of Parliament - to restore our public services, to ensure everyone can once more see an NHS dentist and make GP appointments, to build more affordable housing, to clean up our rivers, to invest in sustainable flood protection and to make life better for our communities.

Waveney Valley is one of the party's top target seats at this General Election. In the 2023 elections, Greens got the most votes across this whole area, with the Conservatives second and other parties a long way behind.

It is an honour to have been selected as the Conservative Candidate for the new Waveney Valley Constituency at the next General Election. While our area is divided by a county border, it is united in potential to be an even better place for us to live, work and do business. On these pages, you can read, more about me and my priorities if elected as the first MP for Waveney Valley. 

As a Conservative, I want to protect and enhance what makes our country great – be it our countryside, farming community, heritage or culture. I want to protect free markets and harness and enhance our ability to innovate. I fundamentally believe in personal freedom and the ability of the individual, and society collectively, to improve lives and prosper when not overly burdened by regulation or taxation.

By freeing the individual and helping them to improve their lives through their own efforts, we can focus our support on those vulnerable members of society who most need it. All whilst allowing individuals to choose how they live their lives with minimal interference from the state.

I grew up in Suffolk where my father was a Consultant and my mother an Occupational Therapist at West Suffolk Hospital. My father, of whom I have no memory, died of cancer when I was little over a year old. His legacy in the community inspired me to public service. I watched my mother work hard to support us and struggled personally and academically after she remarried but fortunately found a mentor in a local businessman who encouraged me to strive for success. These challenging early years shaped much of my outlook today.

My grandparents were farmers and we’ve still a very small farm remaining. As a result, I’ve always been acutely aware of how our agricultural community, landscapes, countryside and wildlife all define, shape and sustain our nation. I’ve seen at first-hand how ill-conceived development, planning and energy policies can threaten these defining characteristics. Here in Waveney Valley, the importance of these issues could not be more acute. With a grandparent from Norfolk and Suffolk, I’m no stranger to the friendly rivalry between our two counties!

Family values are incredibly important to me. I live in Suffolk with my wife, Caroline, whose family home is in Mellis near Diss, and our five dogs.

I’ve experience across the private and public sector. My early career was spent advising Members of Parliament, parliamentary candidates and think tanks. This enabled me to learn, very quickly, how to get things done in Westminster. My work also focused on media relations and ensuring local communities benefitted from the best possible representation. Taking a break from the political sphere, I opened a gym which brought CrossFit to the community at an affordable price. During the same period, we diversified our small family farm through the creation of a wedding and events venue – now an award winning rural business. In 2017, I was elected to Suffolk County Council, where I serve as Deputy Leader.

I have become the most experienced politician in the UK at responding to Nationally Significant Infrastructure Projects (NSIPs) in the energy sector. I have devised our strategy and response to numerous large energy projects and led negotiations with government and developers. I’ve led on our opposition to the East Anglia Green pylon run (now known as Norwich to Tilbury) and our calls for an offshore alternative, our negotiations with EDF around the delivery of Sizewell C, securing a compensation and mitigation package in excess of £200m for the region, alongside fighting proposals for the Sunnica Solar Farm. I have spoken on the national stage, and written for Conservative Home, about the importance of delivering energy security and how it must not come at the cost of good food producing land. This work requires me to meet regularly with government departments, ministers and officials to fight for the best deal for local communities.

I am an experienced and highly visible local campaigner and have served at all council levels from parish through to county. I know how to get things done and ensure local people have confidence in their elected representative.

Dear Neighbours,

I am writing to you today to express my passion and commitment to our community in Sevenoaks. As many of you know, we recently fought against developers and the council to stop the tower block and overdevelopment in our area. However, I believe that the threat of overdevelopment is far from over. That is why I have decided to stand for the District Council in Sevenoaks Northern.

I firmly believe that it is time for a change. We need a new voice on the council who will prioritize the needs and concerns of our community. If elected, I will work tirelessly to ensure our community remains safe, prosperous, and sustainable. My priorities include supporting local businesses and responsible growth that preserves the character of our community, as well as opposing reckless overdevelopment, including tower blocks.

I am also firmly against policies such as "15-minute cities" and other restrictions on movement that could have a negative impact on our community. Instead, I will work to promote a balanced approach to development that considers the needs of our community and respects our way of life.

I hope I can count on your vote in the upcoming election on the 4th of May. Together, we can ensure that our community remains a beautiful place to live, work, and raise a family.

Sincerely,

Daniel Kersten

I am standing as the Labour and Co-operative candidate for Police and Crime Commissioner to bring safer streets to Kent and Medway.

We need a change from 8 years and over £90m of cuts imposed on Kent Police by the Conservatives. Talking to residents around Kent and Medway, they feel crime is ignored, not investigated, not prevented, response is slow and justice for victims even slower. I hear their frustration, we need a change to keep our communities safe.

As your PCC I will:

Fight for vital funding to tackle crime and invest in policing. Develop a police plan in partnership with residents that delivers on your priorities. Prevent and reduce crime and anti-social behaviour. Tackle Domestic Abuse and Violence against Women and Girls. Tackle retail crime. Improve road policing. Tackle rural & coastal crime. Deliver new initiatives to prevent serious organised and knife crime. Focus on getting drugs off our streets. I am a local resident living in Kent with my wife and daughter, I want to make our communities safer for my family, and yours.

I have the experience and passion to deliver on my pledges and will work with you to make our streets safer. I am an experienced campaigner, I brought enforcement agencies together to fight and reduce organised crime. I am a councillor in Kent, representing residents for over 10 years, have chaired companies delivering social change and have served as a trustee for charities.

Please vote for me on 2nd May, a vote for me as the Labour and Co-operative candidate is the only way to deliver positive change in this election.

Prepared by Shane Mochrie-Cox (Agent) c/o SE Labour, Unit 6, Gamma House, Laser Quay, Rochester, ME2 4HU.

Kate will be standing for re-election to Ashford Borough Council for Rolvenden & Tenterden West, as a Green Party candidate, building on 4 years of work on behalf of all residents as an independent.  Kate has been working hard all year round helping residents with their, working in the community and standing up for the countryside. Kate is a local sheep farmer who also runs a small holiday letting business on the farm and a vineyard.  She previously worked as a lawyer, is married with two adult children and is a carer for a disabled family member. Vote Green Party on the 4th of May to elect dedicated councillors who get the job done.
